6:54 AM
I see we do a bit of trolling...
billy big balls 2/12/2022 2:03 PM
It is decided to end their misery. Nothing more can be done. You exit the Church and head to the forest, filled with the dead, the wounded, and some of the still alive but disoriented Grenadiers. You come across a wounded Grenadier who begs for help. "Please... help me... I beg of you." You shake your head and abruptly raise the flintlock to his head, blasting it. Blood spews everywhere, including on your uniform. You reload it while shaking your head. Another Grenadier is cowering behind a tree. "NO! PLEASE, I BEG OF YOU! PLEASE!" But it is to no avail. He ends up with a sabre slice around his neck. You move from one Grenadier onto the other, finishing them off with either sabre or flintlock. Satisfied with their elimination, you head back to the Church to rest. You climb the stairs, turning right to the doors, and opening them. Behold, Count von Maximilianerberhardtwilhelmusgoerlitzscheitzhaus and his Austrian Grenadiers... with a Bavarian woman? Lying at the feet of the Count, she is tattered, bruised, and bloodied. Her uniform is ripped and torn. "Welcome to our humble abode good sir!" proclaims the Count. "I am very delighted to have the... honor, to meet you at last! And may I congratulate you on being able to evade us skillfully without my Grenadiers noticing you? Bravo indeed!" You nod suspiciously. "Who's the woman?" "The woman? That is one of your fellow regimental commanding officers!" he sneers. "And my, isn't she a treat..." You'd move your hand to your flintlock. "Don't do anything stupid Count. You wouldn't want a metal ball to your head now, would you?" "Try me Austrian..." he smiles gleefully. The Count would grab her up and put his sword to her neck. "Come on then... have her." You'd take a deep breath.
billy big balls 2/13/2022 12:29 PM
1Ô∏è‚É£ Save the mysterious woman. These bastards cannot get their dirty hands on her! 2Ô∏è‚É£ Leave the Count and the woman to their fate and escape to your Regiment. 3Ô∏è‚É£ Take every Austrian down with no regard to the fate of the woman. Our survival matters more, doesn't it? @Text Story Please revote for your answers. billy big balls 2/18/2022 4:26 PM
"Alright Count... I'll concede to your demands..." you speak. The Count smiles at you. "Good... for your understanding, I'll let her be." He drops her to the floor in an instant. "Just the way I wanted it." you proclaim, quickdrawing your flintlock and striking the nearest Grenadier to his right. He falls in an instant. "WHAT IN THE-" he yells. The Bavarian woman does a kickflip, landing her heel on his private parts. The Count wails in agony, wriggling on the floor. Meanwhile, you're taking down the Grenadiers as best as you can, yet they put up as best of a fight as they can. One lunges at you with a bayonet, yet you skillfully maneuver it and shove it up one of his comrade's throats. Another tries to take you down with his sabre pinning you to the wall. You cough and try to wriggle out, but he's pressuring and pressuring... until you hear some gurgling. You look up and see blood spattering all over his neck. He falls to the floor. "Well pretty boy, I'm sure you'll owe me for that some day." The Bavarian woman is looking at you in an inquisitive manner, blood spattered all over her body. "Yeah... you ready to get the hell out of here?" you ask, brushing your coat off. 1Ô∏è‚É£ Escape once and for all to finish this story! [Story ends in a neutral but rewarding ending] 2Ô∏è‚É£ Wait... I think we forgot something... did we? @Text Story NEW TEXT STORY VOTE VOTE VOTE :)

billy big balls 2/20/2022 8:44 PM
You both look at each other. "I think we almost forgot something," you say to the woman. "I think we did!" she'd reply. Both of you turn around and see Count von Maximilianerberhardtwilhelmusgoerlitzscheitzhaus groaning in pain while clutching his treasure. "Mrgm... ah... bloody hell..." He'd reach for a flintlock near his foot, but you'd step on his hand and give it a sharp twist. He'd yell in surprise. "So Count. Did you really think I'd surrender to you? Indeed not," you'd sneer, "What were you planning to do with this fine lady..." You would turn to the woman. "Might I inquire as to your name Madam?" She'd blush as to the question "Zoe Erhardt," she'd curtsy. "Very enchanting name. The name is Bruce Aeigh, 4. Infanterie-Regiment." you'd bow. The Count would laugh at both of you, probably thinking of you as insane. "Back to the question." you'd resume. "What were you planning to do with this fine lady Count?" The Count stares at you. "None of that concerns you... Bavarian." "Indeed not," you'd retort. "Well then. You are officially a prisoner of war now that we have you secured from your Grenadiers. We will treat you as amicably as we can, as long as you show us proper respect." The Bavarian woman would lift the Count up and drag him behind her. "We've got to get a move on if we need to head back to camp." she'd say to you. You'd agree and help carry him down the steps of the Church. You walk and walk... until reaching the end of the town. "Camp's gonna be to the right of us in the forest." you'd beckon. Switching directions, you head towards the entrance of the forest. Just as you near the treeline, you heard shots whizz by you. Both of you turn to see some Grenadiers pursuing after you. "CRAP!" you yell. The Grenadiers shout a fearsome war cry to intimidate the two of you.
8:44 PM
1Ô∏è‚É£ Hold them off as best as you can with the Bavarian woman 2Ô∏è‚É£ Leave Count von Maximilianerberhardtwilhelmusgoerlitzscheitzhaus behind and save yourselves 3Ô∏è‚É£ Run into the forest with the Count @Text Story Hot and ready, ready and hot, git yer text story right here and now!

5:50 AM
billy big balls 2/24/2022 7:03 AM
Zoe takes a spare musket from you and heads to the house entrance to defend you guys. "I'LL REMAIN HERE WITH THE COUNT!" you yell, pulling him towards tree cover whilst tied up. "YOUR TIME IS UP BAVARIAN! YOUR. TIME. IS. UP! HAHAHAHA!" laughs the Count. You throw a punch to his face that knocks him out for some time. Gunfire erupts all around you as you try to take scope of the situation. Suddenly, a grenadier busts through a house window near your tree and proceeds to tackle you. He tries to choke you unconscious. Yet... you struggle and struggle until you throw a punch into his jaw. He stumbles off you for a second, enabling you to strike him a few more times. You manage to take him out. You breathe a sigh of relief and notice that the sound of gunfire has disappeared. You begin to wonder about Zoe. Without noticing, the Count managed to regain his flintlock and proceeded to click the hammer back. You immediately turn, jumping onto him. The shot is fired into a nearby trunk of a tree. You both engage in a grueling brawl until... you lose your momentum and fall captive to the Count. "So Bruce Aeigh... I assume this is where we end our formal acquaintance of each other," he smirks. You turn your head smiling. "Maybe... but Austria will never win. I promise you..." The Count snorts at you and prepares the sword. "I still have plenty of men to overpower your puny regiment. I haven't seen a single Bavarian regiment overtake my Grenadiers. Not once... and never will it happen." Zoe walks up to you both. "WAIT!" she'd shout, aiming a musket at the Count. "HOLD IT RIGHT THERE PRINCESS! UNLESS YOU WANT YOUR BELOVED OFFICER TO DIE... I SUGGEST YOU DON'T MAKE A MOVE!" yells the Count. She'd retort with a laugh. "You honestly think you'll get out of here alive? Your Grenadiers are finished. FINISHED I SAY!" The Count looks around. "You must be joking!"
7:07 AM
"Joking? Never my dear Count..." she'd raise the head of a Grenadier that was chopped off. "You want to talk?" The Count would stare at the head for a moment. "I'd rather finish this imbecile off." Zoe drops the head. "Yet he spared your life instead of finishing him off. You want him to die? I thought officers were gentlemen, not monsters! However... if you spare him and let him be... I'll allow myself to be with you..." The Count thinks for a moment. 1Ô∏è‚É£ Take immediate action and finish him off right now 2Ô∏è‚É£ Find the right moment to distract the Count and take him out 3Ô∏è‚É£ Let your character and Zoe be taken prisoner by him @Text Story Juicy text story hungry... :)

38
billy big balls 3/2/2022 1:09 AM
While the Count speaks, you try to remember any weak spots that can take him down. Then you remember... You abruptly slam your fist onto his treasure pouch... once more. He yells in shock, dropping his flintlock. You pick it up and step beside Zoe, aiming it at him. "I'm afraid this ends now." you shrug. Pulling the trigger, the hammer cracks, and K-POW! The Count's life ends with a bloody finale to the head. Satisfied, you put the flintlock away while Zoe stares at his lifeless corpse. "I... I didn't know you'd..." You pat her back while playfully saying, "What, you think I don't know how to kill efficiently? Oh, the humanity!" She chuckles after that. "Oh yeah... totally." Both of you begin your long foresty journey to the camp. After some time, you reach two Bavarian guards who are patrolling the entrance. "Halt! State who you two are!" one of them yells, musket at the ready. "It's Aeigh..." you raise your hand. The guard pauses momentarily. "Oh! Right." he salutes. You nod back to him while walking in the camp. "The woman's with me as well." As you walk toward the center of the camp, your men surround both of you and cheer your return with cries of "LONG LIVE OUR BAVARIAN NAPOLEON!", "THREE CHEERS TO AEIGH!", and "WHO THE HELL IS THAT WOMAN??" Acknowledging them, you walk onto your tent to rest after your long day. "Well. I suppose that is that. It was nice knowing you. Hopefully we get to meet each other again in better conditions." you smile. Zoe winks at you, "Oh I'm not finished with you yet... this is a little thank you for saving me back there..." She kisses you on the lips full-on, pushing you back inside the tent and closing the covers to have some... time with you :) THE END

Deleted User 3/13/2022 11:40 AM
Welcome to the Blood and Iron text story, today, our story starts in Russia, 1812. The French Empire is fighting against the Russian Empire in a frozen forest. You are a French light infantry, equipped with a musket, and a standard sabre. Your name is Xavior. Your mission is to assist your nation to defeat the Russian Empire, every choice you make will affect the story's outcomes. Are you ready? This is the battle of the Frozen Forest. -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- 1812, Russia. You walked on the freezing snow, your shoes are barely stitched so your foot is freezing. You are marching with a platoon of soldiers to the nearest camp. Nothing is happening currently, so your mind starts to drift. You watched as the accumulating snow on the branches makes the wood fall off, hitting a soldier in the head as he cursed in agony. There is a frozen pond in the distance, you see a snow rabbit skipping across the pond bank. Suddenly, your senses are bought back as the person in front of you stopped. Something was holding up the line, but what? As word spread around the group, you learned that a bridge leading to the forest has been destroyed by the Russians. Now you can't get across the two sides. The commander is desperately trying to figure out another way. The line has been dissembled and you can now free roam. You get closer to take a look at the bridge and see that it's in ruins. You look left and right to see if anything can help, then you spot a fallen tree that is stuck between the two riverbeds. On the left side, you see a little shack with boats with a sign that reads "River Crossing Service." You inform the commander about this, he asks for your opinion. What do you do? 1Ô∏è‚É£Take the risk and cross the river via the fallen tree. 2Ô∏è‚É£Head to the shack. 3Ô∏è‚É£Try to repair the bridge. Time is crucial!

@Text Story
Deleted User 3/15/2022 8:56 PM
Choice 2Ô∏è‚É£You head to the shack. You tell the commander that you wanted to use the boats for transportation. He accepts your decisions and orders your platoon to advance to the crossing service. Once you get there, 3 men greet you and list you the price right away. Luckily, your commander tells you that you have enough to pay for the service. There are only 4 boats docked, and you have 50 men in your platoon, each boat can fit 3 people at a time. ... Finally, after spending the entire day, you and your group finally crossed the river. The commander is pissed at your decision as it heavily slowed the army to a crawl. Now it will take more time to get to the warzone. Well done. ... The night was cold and silent, no one in the platoon made a sound, the howling winds blew between the trees, like a tiger in the bushes stalking its prey. The wind blew and scratched your face. You shivered. What should have been a warm night's sleep at the camp close to the battlefield turned into a midnight walk in the middle of nowhere. There are sudden commotions at the front of the line, people were slowing down. You picked your head up and saw the commander upfront scratching his head, looking at his map and the compass, you assume he's lost the directions. "Great, more slowing down." You hear a soldier behind you speak in a hateful tone. You cringe as your decision leads to the whole army's misery. Men are beginning to yawn as muskets are being lowered and dropped accidentally. People are getting tired. The commander has ordered the men to set up camp, right after hearing those words, 3 eager sappers jumped up and got to work. After standing in the freezing cold for 30 or so minutes, a makeshift camp was ready. Everyone was cheering and ran into the tents, soon, there was silence. ...
8:56 PM
"WOAH! HELP! RUSSIANS!" You jolted up from the ground and were alerted right away. "RUSSIANS AROUND THE CAMP!" a soldier yelled, shots were being fired outside and the screams of agony filled your ears. "WHEN DID THEY GET HERE?" a soldier beside you rose up, grabbed his musket, and went outside. You soon geared up and the camp was in chaos. Soldiers clashing with their swords, muskets being fired, and corpses on the floor. You grabbed a dead soldier's pistol and joined the battle. Make your choice time... 1Ô∏è‚É£Fight the enemy head-on, kill as many as possible. 2Ô∏è‚É£Stay back and try to figure out the enemy count, you might lose men if you pick this option. 3Ô∏è‚É£Run away from the commotion, find help. Surrender.

Choice 1Ô∏è‚É£ There will be blood. "VIVE LA FRANCE!" You yelled and jumped into battle. You raised your sword and hopped into a group of men fighting. A sharp pain bought you back to reality as you turn around and saw a Russian partisan thrusting his scythe into your back, you gasped. Blood poured out of the wound near your lower abdomen, a fatal blow indeed. You fell forward onto the ground and soon blood gushed all around you. Your vision is going black, the gleaming snow is now stained with your blood. ... But are you...Dead? No, of course, you aren't, right? Right? ... The fields were quiet, not a sound except for an owl hooting on the tree branch, from where you are, you can hear a creek running in the distance, the babbling waters gave harmony to the eerie silence. You groaned, surprising, you didn't die from the scythe wound, it only penetrated a few inches of your skin. In the distance, you see a shadowy figure moving through the trees, you picked yourself up and squinted closely. The figure jumped out of the trees and pointed its pistol at you. You froze. What do you do? 1Ô∏è‚É£Retaliate, find something to defend yourself with, and don't go down without a fight. 2Ô∏è‚É£Attempt to communicate with the figure, maybe it's friendly? 3Ô∏è‚É£Runaway. @Text Story (edited)

2Ô∏è‚É£Attempt to communicate with the figure, what will happen? "Hello?" You try to initiate the conversation, the figure shooked, you scared it. The figure hesitated, it stepped closer into the light, you were able to see its face more clearly. From what you can make out, it's a woman. She took off her hood, but her pistol is still close to your face, one wrong move, and your head's gone. You see a medic symbol on her left arm, she's a war medic. So you ask her if she can help with your wounds, it isn't much but, it still hurts like hell. The woman lowered her gun, you see a French pin near her chest, she is on your team. She reached into her bag and pulled out some bandages, she asks to see your wound. You lay flat on the ground, while she takes care of your lacerations, you began to think how you just lost your entire platoon. What are you going to do now? "Hey, what's your name?" You asked. "Meryl." She replied, guess her name's Meryl, you thought to yourself, at least you have some company. Choice 4Ô∏è‚É£ You ask Meryl for advice. "Hey", you said, "Do you know where I should go?" Meryl didn't reply, she was inspecting a dead soldier's body. "He had a family", she said, trembling. You concluded that she doesn't want to be in this position, she's young, you assumed that her age is around 18 or so. "You can go to my farm", she said. She told you that her family lives there and they can provide you with shelter. (Since you chose choice 4, you agree to go with her). After a light walk through the forest, you see light in the distance, it looks like Meryl's farm isn't too far away from where your platoon sat up camp, maybe that's why she was able to find you. Meryl knocked on the door, she knocked lightly at first, then heavy, it must be some sort of code. The door opened and Meryl's father welcomed her, he asked her about you. She told him that you were a friend. You enter the house, there were 2 people already sitting there, a woman, and a kid, around 10 years old. Something was on the table. The woman introduced her as Meryl's mother, Shelly, and the kid said his name was Jackson. "This is a map of where we are", Shelly said, "There is a huge group of Russians just 2 miles away from us". The father chimed in, "We've always wanted to scout out their location and send it to the French army, but we have to take care of Jackson, can you go?" Deleted User 3/26/2022 8:27 PM
1Ô∏è‚É£Time to scout. Meryl's father woke you up, you groaned and tried to turn around, he grabbed your blanket and flipped it off. You didn't care and went back to sleep. Minutes later, water splashed on your face, and you were trenched within a second, Meryl's father smiled, you see buckets of water on the ground. Surprisingly, you fit into Meryl's father's clothes, so now you look like a regular civilian, less risk of being detected. The breakfast was bacon and some bread, you ate, and were instructed to meet Meryl outside. "You look awfully like my father," Meryl said. "Your father appointed me as the leader of this mission, so I am sort of your guardian." You replied. "I never get to have any fun." She whined. Following the map, you two make it to the base of a forest, there are multiple ruined structures visible, a fight must have already happened. On the map, it says that you are in the Frozen Forest. "So, where are the Russians?" You said. "My father said we have to go north, there is a big camp of them there," Meryl replied. Sometime later, you two reached a ruined structure, the walls have been blasted open, there was no roof. You decided that it was a good idea to head up the stairs, Meryl almost tripped on a cannonball. "Careful," you said. You looked out a window with a spyglass and saw a huge Russian group not too far away, you froze. You see rankers and officers everywhere, cavalry galloping in the fields. "That must be the Russian force I was told to fight, but the thing is, my gun against thousands isn't enough." You murmured. Meryl tapped your shoulder, you signaled to look left. There were two men hiding behind a giant tree, spying on the Russians too, who are they? Should you attack? Should you attempt to talk to them? What do you do? 1Ô∏è‚É£Watch their movements. 2Ô∏è‚É£Attack them. 3Ô∏è‚É£Maybe they are scouts too, you should talk to them. @Text Story

Deleted User 3/29/2022 5:22 PM
1Ô∏è‚É£Watch their movements. Who are they? You thought in your head, why are they spying on the Russians? Something in your mind decided not to engage them, you chose to stalk their movements. You see the younger one of the two take out a notepad and wrote something down, the bigger one is telling him information. You took the spyglass and tried to decipher what they are writing. 750 men... 40 officers... Sturdy base. What the, why are they taking notes on the Russians? If they are studying the Russians, then they must not be Russians. You take a good look at the two, they look like they are from France, and you see a French chest pin on their clothes. "They are French spies," you said. "We should follow them, maybe they will lead us to a French encampment." You followed the French men for a long time, after they crossed a mountain, you see a camp that had the French flag. "YES!" You exclaimed, you've finally found your nation's camp. Meryl was shocked, she has never seen a camp that big. Suddenly, the two French men appeared behind you and seized you. "You are coming with us," the bigger French men said. "We know that you have been following us this whole time." You've been captured... You are Meryl are thrown in a cell, soon, an officer came in and interrogated you. "Look!" You yelled, "I am a French light infantry soldier, I was suppose to be back up but our platoon was ambushed on our way here, you have to trust me." The officer studied you, you don't have anything to prove that you are actually a French soldier, what do you do? 1Ô∏è‚É£Keep on trying to convince the officer. 2Ô∏è‚É£Ask Meryl if she knows anything. 3Ô∏è‚É£Give the name of your commander and see if that rings any bells. 4Ô∏è‚É£Attempt to break out. @Text Story VOTE VOTE VOTE

„ÄÜ Ayhan 4/18/2022 1:01 PM
Spain, 1800s. It was a normal day with normal weather, as both armies marched into the battlefield, the madness begin. You were in a rifle regiment marching into the frontlines. The officer told you to halt. Officers started leading their regiments into the places of battle, with sappers building the front and militia being trained. Your general, Joseph, was looking at the farmhouse and said, "The English, captured the farmhouse already..."  As you watch them making plans for the battle, you realize the English soldiers has fortified the farmhouse, placing their troops in the frontlines, at any entrance and inside. It was going to be harder to capture it, as you were observing. You notice your squad is forming up, so you form up with the rest of your battalion.
1:01 PM
You started watching sappers while waiting for orders. They were cutting trees down and placing sandbags one by one and building barricades next to them. Then they put ammo boxes inside the trenches. It was interesting to watch them build. Their jobs were hard, though. You remember when your father told you you could be a sapper so you could actually do something for once in your life. You hated him for saying that. Your officer said he'd be back soon, so you could leave the line, you took a deep breath. You sat on a sandbag and started thinking about your family, will you survive? will you make out of this war? While thinking, you hear a shout of "Rule Britain! CHARGE! " You quickly take your rifle and prepare. All units start mobilizing into sandbags and sapper forts.  Your general said "They are attacking!" As you quickly stand up to see the front, the UK was mobilizing their highlanders and infantry into the fort that sappers were building, as they sent militia and infantry to hold them off. All light infantry regiments divided their regiments into 2 companies: "Flank Watch" and "Front Line". You had no time to think, soldiers were getting in their position as first wave started and UK Infantry tried to breach in, You need to make your choice now. Where will you fight? Flank watch: Watch for enemy that is trying to enter from other sides to sabotage the formation. 1Ô∏è‚É£ Front line: Face the enemy directly 2Ô∏è‚É£ (edited)

„ÄÜ Ayhan 4/20/2022 2:07 PM
You choose to fight in Flank Watch. Your officer returned to the formation while waiting. You were assigned to flank watch. The officer led you to the trench. With other skirmishers and militia to support you. You sit on a box in the trench, waiting, thinking about what to do. You hear heavy marching and British grenadiers marching, and you say, "Oh screw it." You took your musket and checked. You saw the house hold guard marching into your trench. They were tough and sure of themselves. Your officer told you to "Make ready." All the rankers draw their muskets at once into the face of the enemy. The officer took a deep breath under his orders and said, "Fire!" As everyone fired their muskets, the guard was completely destroyed. You started reloading, as everyone did, The smoke was closing your vision annoyingly. Your officer shouted, "That's not the end of them!" He was right.
2:07 PM
Now the 92nd highlanders were coming, and your regiment had no time to reload... You had to fight with melee while everyone started putting their bayonets/taking their swords, You closed your eyes and said, "For the fatherland" as you took out your sword and ran into the fight. You charge into the highlanders. A ranker tries to stab you with a bayonet. You block it with your sword and kick his b... He went into the ground. You don't have to kill him. He's done anyway. As you dealt with others, you quickly got an advantage and cut through the ranks of the 92nd. You dealt with the wave quickly, and you had a major advantage since the militia was armed with axes and other strong melee weapons. The militia were holding off the other alive rankers as you returned to the trench, and you heard a shout of "Front Line is Breaking!" You quickly go to check it out. All the British soldiers were breaking the front coming in. They were stopped by militia, but it wasn't enough to hold them. At the same time, they sent a small group of soldiers to your trench. Your officer said, "Either we should divide again or everyone should go to the front line." 1Ô∏è‚É£ Send all troops into front 2Ô∏è‚É£ Leave the militia to watch flanks and send skirmishers into front 3Ô∏è‚É£ Stay where you are, don't go to front. „ÄÜ Ayhan 4/25/2022 10:41 AM
You decided to check the house. While charging in, you saw figures from the window of a house. You decided to go check on the house since there might be innocent people there. You took out your musket and prepared it in case there was an enemy soldier. You slowly opened the door. It was empty. There was someone upstairs, and you heard noises. You slowly go up. And... There was a family there, and they were Polish! "Hello?" you tried to communicate with them. They didn't answer. "Hello? Are you guys okay? " You mentioned it again: there was an elderly man with his child, his wife appeared to be dead, and they were in pain. "They did this to us..." he said. "Look, I will try to get you out of here. We need to move," you said." The man took his child with him. His child was a young boy with brown hair. He was around 6‚Äì8 years old. As you go down the stairs, as you open the door, "Before we go, what's your name, sir?" You said  "Aleksander" The old man said, "My son's name is Jan." "Alright, it's time to move out." 10:41 AM
As you opened it, you saw the 95th rifles. As you saw them, you quickly kicked one of them into the ground and stabbed him with your sword. While the enemies took out their swords, you quickly shot one of them in the head. They tried to shoot you, and they almost shot Aleksander. You quickly took them to the old fort that Warsaw built in the beginning. You pointed to the main base. "Go there and ask for help. They should guide you guys. " While telling them what to do, two 95th rifles turned the corner of the trench, firing their muskets. Two of them hit Aleksander in the head and leg. He fell to the ground, dying slowly in pain. Everything happened quickly. You didn't even have a chance to do anything. You quickly took out your sword and charged at them, taking both of them out while you turned back. Jan was dead. He was stabbed in the back by another soldier. He went into the ground.
10:41 AM
You quickly kicked the soldier that killed Jan into the ground and killed him. You checked on his father first. He was dead. You started crying in pain, "Please respond, this wasn't supposed to be like this, frick!" He didn't respond, nor did you feel his heartbeats. You checked on Jan. You looked at his face. His eyeballs were gone. You got creeps. You saw a shovel in the trench, you dug in and put their bodies there and said, "Rest in peace." You move back to the battlefield, where you forget about the battle while all of this mess happened. But there's good news: the Vistule legion and your army were able to repel the grenadiers and British. One problem, though, your army started setting up tents in front of houses. You asked your officer what happened. "We were able to push them off. They hid in these 3 houses, and built barricades and shut doors. So we gotta make our plan again to breach into these houses, and also keep in mind that their commanders are hiding in the biggest one. " Night is approaching. You get into your tent again. You were in a dark place with nothing. You were in a forest. You started hearing laughter. You saw Jan with his dark eyes. You started following him; he was laughing and crying at the same time. You were terrified. He stopped for a second and looked into your soul with his dark eyes. He started burning. When you wake up from this terrible dream, Everyone is slowly waking up for the siege. It's time to make your plans for the siege. (edited)

„ÄÜ Ayhan 5/2/2022 5:49 AM
Your army decided to attack House 3 containing field marechal of British army. After a successful siege of the first house, 10 British riflemen and the 95th CO were taken hostage. Everyone was chanting, "Glory to Warsaw!" The success of the siege gives your army a morale boost. While you started walking out of the house, the British soldiers were staring at your army. They couldn't do anything, though; the barricades were blocking their muskets. While moving, you saw your general coming. Pointing at the 3rd house, "Their marechal is there. If we capture it, this ends here!" Your army is slowly mobilizing at house 3. Your group noticed a soldier from the window watching you guys. He quickly moved up the stairs and warned others. Your army got into positions and prepared their muskets.  Vistule legion was left behind to keep an eye on House 2 in case they attempted to flee. The sappers came at the doors and started breaking the barricades slowly. As they did, shots were heard coming from British soldiers' windows. Shamefully, they all missed. As doors were broken, your army slowly started mobilizing inside. You were met with a volley, destroying your first charge, though it was not enough, your army quickly got in house making enemys volleys useless,  going upstairs, you were met by heavy fortification and defences, As soon as the soldiers in house 2 saw the fall of house 3, they went outside, and a fight broke out between Vistule and the grenadier-highlanders. Vistule requested backup, and while your army was unsure of what to do, the field marechal jumped from the window with other soldiers and began running.
5:50 AM

While British soldiers were leaving the farmhouse, they fired back to slow you guys down. One of the shots hit you right in the chest. Your screen becomes blurry. You got on the ground. You lie on a sandbag. While you slowly closed your eyes, all you saw was your comrades waving the Warsaw flag and Vistule flag. You smiled and closed your eyes.

Anti_Avatar 5/12/2022 6:06 PM
You have joined the United Kingdom God Save the King! Choose your unit: 23rd Regiment of Foot: Royal Welsh Fusiliers As a line infantryman, you will be part of a large force heading to secure the barns in the middle of the wheat fields, supported by riflemen and light infantry to drive your attack deeper into enemy turf. Well-rounded and capable of self-defense against cavalry, you will be encouraged to stick with your group for maximum effectiveness. 10th Regiment of Hussars: The Prince of Wale's Own Royal Hussars Hussars: Fast, sudden, but very weak against anti-cavalry units and highly reliant on their horses. Your mission would be to take out the enemy artillery and distract enemy foot soldiers while friendly forces advance. If you manage to survive this early onslaught, you can terrorize any enemy that stray too far from their units. 1st Light Battalion, KGL: King's German Legion Highly trained skirmishers armed with light infantry muskets and swords, capable of close-quarters self-defense and longer-range shooting than a regular line infantryman. You will be part of a small team flanking around the barns to sabotage enemy construction and advances early on, before joining the main force. 42nd Regiment of Foot: The Black Watch Being a sapper of the Scottish Black Watch regiment, your task will be to help friendly riflemen get onto the barn rooves to snipe any incoming foe and suppress any chance of an enemy push. While not armed with a gun, your tools should keep you and your allies out of harm's way, while your axe provides a formidable defense up close.

Anti_Avatar 5/16/2022 7:02 PM
Story starting soon...
Anti_Avatar 5/16/2022 7:54 PM
Somewhere in Western Germany, 1813 As you hype yourself up before heading into battle with your small unit, you recite the general's words one last time: "About twenty miles west of our position is the river Rhine: our ticket into France. A fortified position of Napoleon's Middle and Young Guard are defending a pair of barns supplying the French with some food. Taking this barn will give us a launch point for us to take out the artillery positions that have been hammering the Prussians for weeks. Your task will be to eliminate the French sappers fortifying the barns for our regular infantry to advance. Take care of it."
7:54 PM
You are Corporal Edmund Schwarz of the King's German Legion. With you is a squad of nine other men similarly equipped with your standard-issue Brown Bess musket, and similarly experienced in war since 1803. As you get over the hill, you observe the battlefield: three barns at the flanks of a deserted wheat field. The main line infantry platoon appears to be holed up in a lone barn opposite of the two neighbouring ones occupied by the French, who are closer to you. The initial wave of cavalry hasn't done much to silence the lone artillery cannon overlooking the field, preventing other troops from attacking the barns. While observing the rear side of the French-defended barns, you spot your main targets: a small team of Old Guard sappers erecting defenses at the back and a number of riflemen accompanying them. Experience tells you that they might create a ladder soon to get those riflemen to the roof. There's not much cover between your team and the damn frog-eaters except some sparse, lone trees. "Everyone get into position." Everyone in your team finds a tree for cover and cocks their loaded muskets. You do too. The element of surprise is on your side for now, and you need to make a decision now before the French can further defend their position. A platoon assault is scheduled to occur about now, so you shouldn't worry about enemy reinforcements from the barn.
7:54 PM
What will you do? 1Ô∏è‚É£: Open fire from where you are and hope to eliminate the riflemen and sappers. Unlike them, you have a numerical advantage and adequate cover, but the riflemen still outrange you. 2Ô∏è‚É£: Have six of your men stay and provide covering fire, while you and the other three rush in to take their positions. 3Ô∏è‚É£: Get everyone to rush in and (hopefully) take out the enemies.

@Text Story
billy big balls 5/17/2022 4:37 PM
Your squad opens fire on the group. The shots wipe out the sappers and a few of the riflemen, leaving the other ones to run away. "That's that," you say to your men. They agree wholeheartedly and reload their weapons. As they do, you notice some neighing in the distance. You shade your eyes and look outwards. French cavalry comes into view, with dragoons and hussars alike. "CAVALRY!" you yell to your men. "RETREAT ON ME!" Your men clamber along and run with you towards one of the secure outposts near your artillery. You hear the hooves of the cavalry galloping towards you, forcing your squad to run faster and faster. Then, you halt... "FIX BAYONETS!" you yell. Your squad fixed their bayonets and points them to the cavalry. "HOLD FAST! HOLD FAST!" you urge them. Second by second passes and the cavalry rushes forth. Then, a shot rings out. One of your squadmates fall dead, dropping their musket. "THE DRAGOONS ARE FIRING AT US!" one of your men yell. You grit your teeth in anger. "These French bastards won't see the light in the darkness when I finish through with them..." Closer and closer they come until they are 100 feet away, and you give the order. "RAISE BAYONETS!" Your men raise bayonets and crouch. Stabbing and slicing can be heard as the horses yell out and tumble to the ground along with their men. Close quarter combat ensues, and swords and bayonets alike parried and jabbed at their target. A cavalryman lunges at you, but you grab his head and slice it with a bayonet. He falls to the ground instantly. You pick up their pistol and aim it at another cavalryman. They attempt to stab you but you fire at their head. She falls to the ground promptly as well. The French sound the retreat on their bugle and begin pulling back. You finish off the stragglers and come together. "Gentlemen... we did well..." you pant. "Corporal, we lost Adenauer and Krause." one of the squadmates replies. (edited)

The Most Reverend fuzzball525 5/20/2022 2:16 PM
You decide to lead your men back to the outpost "BACK TO THE OUTPOST!" you shout. You and your men make a break for the lone barn, but your progress is slow due to your sharp fighting with those dragoons. Several of your men are beginning to slow down. "Don't give up, boys! We're nearly there!" you encourage your soldiers. But your exhortations are cut short by a bugle signal. The dragoons are back! The green-coated men with their helmets shining in the sun have recovered from their setback against your squad and are charging you on horseback! "SCATTER!" you cry. Your men nod and split off in different directions. Some run to fight the dragoons and buy time, a few run to the French-held barns and begin taking potshots, and you run back into your own barn. You lean against a wall and breathe heavily. You're hot, sweaty, tired, and you haven't got much water left. Ah, a stroke of good fortune! There's a bucket of water on the ground. Might be a little dirty, but desperate times call for desperate measures. You check your surroundings to make sure you weren't followed, and then you begin approaching the bucket. You kneel down to scoop some into your canteen... SMASH! An axe slams into the barn floor right in front of you! You stumble back in terror and take out a small knife to defend yourself. "Stay back, whoever you are!" You hold the knife out, pointing it into the darkness. But just when you consider rushing whoever attacked you, a German peasant comes out from behind a haystack. He's covered in dirt and looks like he's been here for a while. "Hallo?" he asks. He doesn't seem overtly hostile, so there's that. "Um, hello." you reply. "Don't worry, I won't hurt you. What are you doing here?" The man puts down the axe and gestures to a corner of the barn that you had previously overlooked. There's a woman with a small child, and the woman has a bloody bandage on her arm. "H-hilf mier..." the woman whispers.
2:17 PM

billy big balls 6/17/2022 12:52 PM
You have enlisted in the Jaeger Karabiner Battalion. Spawning in... As the smoke rises up from the church, you and your group of riflemen rush to the right flank to plug the defenses. The Brunswickers are planning coordinated assaults along the flanks to force the Westphalians to retreat away from the buildings, guaranteeing higher ground for the Brunswickers. You place the men in chosen positions. "LANGSTERN, TO THE CRATES! TAKE THE HIGHEST POSITION POSSIBLE AND SHOOT AT ANY BASTARD THAT COMES!" Langstern takes his position. "FASLEM, WITH ME! THE REST OF YOU, GET INTO COORDINATED FIRING POSITIONS AS PLANNED!" you order. Everyone prepares their rifles and falls into place. You bring Faslem with you as you attempt to scout ahead. "Gronnaeke, I'm sure we can hold our position well, no doubt about that, but what if the Brunswickers mass their forces onto one flank?" asks Faslem nervously. "Then we penetrate them from behind Faslem. These Brunswickers are all action but no strategy." you declare. A crack can be heard. You and Faslem roll to your bellies and fall on the ground. A Brunswick officer and a small patrol walk cautiously around the debris of the fallen defenses, scouting along. "Bastards..." you grunt. Faslem offers to retreat to the others to warn them, but as he's about to get up, you pull him down. "Knowing them, you think we can take them on easily?" Faslem shakes his head "I don't know, but that's up to you Gronnaeke. billy big balls 7/11/2022 12:16 AM
You decide to locate sappers to build fortification for your infantry. "FASLEM, GRAB GUTENBERG AND FIND SOME SAPPERS TO BUILD SOME FORTIFICATIONS NEAR OUR STREET!" you yell as Brunswickers fire in the distance. Faslem and Gutenburg run off with their muskets in hand while you rally your men. Running to a nearby alley, you direct them to aim in the open space, anticipating Brunswickers will check out the area. True to your thinking, a patrol runs to take cover in the area. "FIRE!" you command. Muskets run loose as Brunswick soldiers are cut down screaming in agony. The men reload their rifles quickly as you account for your formation. Meanwhile, Faslem and Gutenburg are heading towards the rear of the church to recruit any sappers from broken down regiments. Selecting a few experienced sappers and volunteers, both men rush with their patched group to meet up with the riflemen. Fortifications are promptly built in a secure location as the riflemen guard it from any oncoming threat. As the men finish building the fortifications, a Westphalian battalion passes by whilst cheering. You go over and talk to their NCO. "What's the cause for celebration?" you ask. The NCO replies, "The bloody Brunswickers have retreated! We might be able to beat them just yet!" The Westphalians march on as they continue their cheers and singing. You think for a minute, pondering what the situation may turn out to be. In your head, you think: "Well that's new, seeing the Brunswickers being this disorganized, we might as well have beat them and can advance. But what if they might have retreated for something else... could it be possible reinforcements arrived for another big push?"

HonorableValour 7/20/2022 8:51 PM
You decided to advance forward... "COMPANY, INTO DOUBLE RANKS, PREPARE TO MARCH!" You order, your men get in line in organized fashion, "MARCH!" You link up with the friendly battalion as a rear company, you keep marching forward until you hear a crackle and see a officer leading the allied advance falls to ground, men rush to help their officer as more and more crackles are heard and men drop in the dozens. Somebody shouts: "BRUNSWICKERS IN THE WINDOWS! OPEN FIRE!" You look to your left and you see Brunswickers opening fire from the windows, "COMPANY, BREAK FORMATION, FIRE AT WILL!" you order. Your men listen to the order and starting laying down fire onto the enemy positions, as more and more men fall, friend and foe. While you're getting into position you see enemies charging in down the road, before they could volley you order your men: "FACE LEFT! FACE LEFT! ENEMY PATROL!" your allies are quick to respond and turn left, to open fire on the enemy. But before you know it, the Brunswickers are among your ranks, with bayonets ready. You and your company go into melee while the rest of your battalion holds down the windows, it is a fierce battle, you pull out your NCO sword and start swinging and swinging, the sword breaks after you kill 4 enemies, you pull out your musket. Aim towards a approaching enemy and fire, the shot goes through his brain and he falls dead. "RETREAT BOYS! RETREAT!" orders the enemy officer, and the foes run away, shattered. You now have 3 options.
8:52 PM
1Ô∏è‚É£ Chase after the enemy company and wipe it out. 2Ô∏è‚É£ Try to use your advantage to flank the Brunswickers in the windows 3Ô∏è‚É£ Rejoin the rest of your battalion to keep skirmishing the foes at the windows. (edited)
8:52 PM
@Text Story First story i offically made and published, what do you think? (tell me in #off-topic) (edited)

HonorableValour 8/6/2022 7:05 PM
You decided to flank the Skirmishers "WITH ME COMPANY A, LETS GO!" your men instanly start following you as you advance to the door, right of the enemies windows. You get aganist the wall right next to the door, and you take a deep breath before swinging the door open with a kick, you aim your musket at the first shocked Brunswicker you see, shooting him through the liver, he dies right away, you step away from the door and one of your allies walks into your place to shoot, the second they step into the doorway they get shot in the arm and fall over in pain, your next soldier takes it more carefully and only peeks in to shoot for a short amount of time. As he shoots, he hits another enemy, then goes back out of the sight of the enemies inside. You then order a charge into the house, the rest of the men who didn't have their bayonets attached fix them, and your other NCO'S pull out their sword. You charge at the head of the company into the hallway and you are instanly fired upon by Brunswickers, but thanks to your men, they shoot the enemies before any of them hit a good shot. You slam your bayonet into a man's chest, turn the bayonet and let go. The rest of your battalion is charging into the house to support you from the other side, squishing the enemy company. You fight like devils until the last hostiles either lay dead, or are surrendered. You stumble out the house with your coat drenched with blood. Nobody dares to speak. That is when you hear even more boots walking across the ground, and you see a enemy regiment double the size of your battalion march down the road. You open your mouth to order your men to take cover, but a enemy bullet goes through your shoulder and throws you aganist the ground, You decide to finally give up.. You have done all the honor of war requires. @Text Story sorry for the unexpected loss! its something I wanted to try to see how'd you guys react, and to add more spice to the story! (edited)

(3Ô∏è‚É£) Captain - You lead a company of men into the fire of the enemies guns, you are a brave hero and your commanding skills can wipe the enemy off the field! (4Ô∏è‚É£) Corporal - You help out your officers as a NCO, you are outfitted with a sword and musket. Lead your platoon and help out your company! (5Ô∏è‚É£) Private - Fresh meat, use your skills and will to fight for your country to send those bastards back! HonorableValour 8/17/2022 10:29 PM
You spawn in a command tent, with other general staff... You take a peak outside the tent, and see men carrying crates and getting into formation to ready for an assault, you look back at the map. Your general states, "Gentlemen, we need to decide where to put our grenadiers. Any ideas?" Everyone in the room has a suggestion, but nobody seems viable enough, you raise your hand and ask, "What are the options?" Your general points to the map. "We can deploy our grenadiers and skirmishers in 3 locations. The forest, the road, or the center. If we make a wrong move, our best men will be destroyed. Do you have any ideas?" You decide to: Put the grenadiers on the road. (1Ô∏è‚É£) Put the grenadiers in the forest. (2Ô∏è‚É£) Put the grenadiers in the center. (3Ô∏è‚É£) Put the skirmishers on the road. (4Ô∏è‚É£) Put the skirmishers in the forest. (5Ô∏è‚É£) Put the skirmishers in the center. (6Ô∏è‚É£) Wait for the enemy to make a move. HonorableValour 8/20/2022 7:00 PM
You decide to deploy the grenadiers in the center and the skirmishers in the forest. You morph into a boots of a private in a voltiguer company. Your allies feet march forward further into the heart of the forest, approaching the house on the side of the British flanks. You look to your right and see Grenadiers of the line, you clench your musket as you hear the shouts of an French officer shout "BRITS IN THE HOUSE!" Shots ring out, and some of your countrymen fall around you. Your officer shouts: "COMPANY, SKIRMISHING FORMATION!" You all proceed to crouch and spread out. You take aim at a British NCO.... And fire. The shot goes through his bladder and he shouts "OH GREAT HEAVENS! MY BOLLOCKS!" as he falls on the ground in pain. You try to ignore what you just did and go back to reloading your musket. You take aim at a enemy ranker and aim, but your shot is too high and knocks off his hat. You look at the grenadiers and see them charging to your aid. Your officer realizes this too and orders an charge, another one of your voltiguer companies flanks from another side. Leaving your foes trapped on 3 sides. As you all charge in it is a brutal melee. You take down 2 with your bayonet. One of them begging for his life as he was already wounded. The remaining foes break out of the encirclement and flee to their comrades inside of the farm house, to be shot in the backs by their officers and your companies alike. Your battalion occupies the farm house and celebrates an victory. However you see an enemy command tent, Inside is the Duke Of Wellington. He put himself near the combat to boost morale. You ask your officer to: Allow you and a platoon to attack the officers tent (1Ô∏è‚É£) You ask your officer to do, nothing! maybe waiting is better.. HonorableValour 8/26/2022 5:04 PM
You stay put.. You decide aganist your will to hold your ground. You sit down and start cleaning the blood off your bayonet, eat your rations, and to check your ammo. You count 4 rounds. You load one into your empty musket and put it next to you along the fence. But the second you close your eyes to hit the sack, you hear pipes in the distance, somebody in your company yells: "NOT AGAIN! THEY'RE COMING!" You sigh and wonder why the narrator can't give you a break, but you proceed to stand up and aim your musket infront of you and see the famed 42nd Regiment advancing towards you, but wait a minute... They aren't rankers! They're pipers! Their entire advance is just.. Pipers! You are confused and try to figure the situation out, but you don't have time to think because they pull out their swords and run right at you. You take aim and blow one of their brains out. Your company volleys along with you. And the Pipers, with absolutely no infantry or artillery support, are mowed down in the dozens. They are forced back after 2 volley's. Which brings you down to 2 rounds. Before you actually have a good rest, you notice something. You look at the farm house and see the Grenadiers finally advance after they charged to your aid around 20 minutes ago. You can ask your officer to take a squad or a platoon to go help out the grenadiers and possibly flank the enemy regiment as they are focused on the front. What do ya say? Let's get those bastards! HonorableValour 8/29/2022 6:05 PM
What the fuck are you even doing, seriously, are you even sane? I- You look at the bagpipes of the enemies you just killed, out of curiosity you pick one up. You play a little note. Everything is quiet... The grenadiers slowly back away in absolute horror, one of them tries to take your pipe. [CBAI] SLave Slapster57 9/18/2022 2:20 PM
You have chosen to play as a Partisan. You gulp as you spawn into the game, materializing behind the farmhouse along with your teammates. The weapons you carry will determine how you play this round, so it's extra important that you know how to use them. You look down to check your weapons, and breathe out a sigh of relief as you recognize... 1Ô∏è‚É£ A war scythe and a militia hammer. [Not to be confused with a war scythe and a sledgehammer. The war scythe is the only Partisan weapon that could be called a long-range melee weapon, as it's able to cleave much farther than your average sword or branch. The militia hammer, on the other hand, isn't as strong, but it is faster and much better equipped to take on enemies in CQC.] 2Ô∏è‚É£ A musketoon and a sword bayonet. [it's time to play shitty rifleman baby let's gooooooo] 3Ô∏è‚É£ A pistol and a sledgehammer. [It's technically not a valid Partisan combination, but who are you to complain? The pistol is able to vaporize anyone who gets up close, and the sledgehammer cleans up anyone who gets past the pistol.] 4Ô∏è‚É£ A rifle and a sickle. [The rifle can shoot people from extreme ranges, so hopefully you'll be able to make sure no one gets close. Maybe you can even climb up the farmhouse to take some potshots from above! Just make sure no one gets near enough to melee you, or you're in for a very bad time.] @Text Story Hey everyone! Sorry for the wait, I've been busy for the last couple days. [CBAI] SLave Slapster57 10/17/2022 9:20 PM
You have chosen to kill P3skyP3sto. Pesky wipes a bead of sweat off his brow and turns. He beckons at you to follow him; you express your affirmation by swinging your sledgehammer into his back. He drops to the ground instantly, recovering almost as quickly by rolling over onto his back. You bring the sledgehammer down again, squeezing your eyes shut and clenching your teeth, and hear a sickening CRUNCH. You open your eyes and realize that Pesky blocked your swing. His Branch sits just above his chest, preventing your sledgehammer from covering any further ground. You sluggishly bring the sledgehammer back up as Pesky scrambles to his feet. He pounces on you almost instantly, and you swing your sledgehammer wildly out of a primal fear. It meets his chest. Holy crap, I didn't know you could teamkill in this game. But before you can afford even a moment to rest, a door behind you opens. You hear the distinct crunch of grass that indicates someone is exiting the farmhouse behind you. They must have seen you (and Pesky's body beside you) by now, because they speak: [ZubenSero]: uhhhhh You're not quite sure whether they're an enemy or a friend, and you're not sure whether or not you can afford the time to catch your breath and check. Instead, without a moment's hesitation, you... 1Ô∏è‚É£ Swing around and attack them with your sledgehammer. [Better to be safe than sorry. Plus, you just killed one of your own teammates. Who's to say they won't be hostile even if they're on your team?] 2Ô∏è‚É£ Turn around to check who they are. [It's the safer option, but you're pretty tired. It'll take a bit longer to ascertain their identity, and in that time they might attack you.] 3Ô∏è‚É£ Throw yourself into their arms and repent. [Lo, what a mighty sin you have committed! What shame! You must repent if you are to have any hope of surviving 'til the battle's end is nigh!] @Text Story number of times in a row slapster has missed his deadline: 4 (edited)

[CBAI] SLave Slapster57 10/23/2022 3:46 PM
You have chosen to throw yourself into Zuben's arms and repent. You turn around and practically tackle Zuben with the sheer force of your own self-pity. He's on your team, thankfully. You wail out in desperation: [bettercallsaulfan381]: idot {Team} [BAI_TextStoryUser]: WGHAT HAVE I DONHE [BAI_TextStoryUser]: WGHAT HAVE I DONHE [ZubenSero]: What [ZubenSero]: Did you kill pesky [BAI_TextStoryUser]: IT WAS IIIIIIIi [BAI_TextStoryUser]: I REPNENT Zuben drops you in an instant, approaching Pesky's body with the sentiment that would normally be reserved for a significant other. You think you see him draw a pistol wait shit shit shit NO You reach for your sledgehammer. It's not fast enough. The air rings out with a thunderous CRACK as Zuben shoots you dead in the chest with his pistol. Your eyes roll up in their sockets, and you unceremoniously drop to the ground. Serves you right for teamkilling, I guess. You have died. You killed a total of 3 men, including 1 of your own teammates. Whoops. Don't feel ashamed! You walk up to the French people and they seem friendly enough. fifer69k00l: how did you get here so quick??? You ignore his question as you realize your goal, you're not here to make friends, you are here to win a Lego Napoleonic game for your ever growing ego. You look around and see the AFK player is in place and the sapper didn't seem to notice you yet. You pull out your sabre and proceed to stab the Fifer four times in his chest while he was still typing. You spin around to- Oh wait. The sapper didn't notice yet, might as well save a reload. You /e cheer into his shop and stab him in the back as he pulls out his axe at the last second. You stab him for the third time in the neck, but he seems to ragequit the second you swing and his body disappears into the abyss. The AFK player wakes up after he finished helping his mom do the dishes. Thankfully he doesn't have enough time to react as you present your musket and proceed to turn him into swiss cheese. You reload your musket and realize you are in a discord channel, you can do anything! You think to yourself as you grab the fifers clothes that seem to morph into you. Oh well, you turn around and see a fellow Russian staring at you with the most confused look in his non-existent pupils Legendlightning321: how Quick! You decide to hold W. You wipe the blood off your sabre and turn to the ruins that are currently occupied by the Fr*nch. You move towards to the ruin and see the two sides duking it out with partisans, cossacks, infantry, and sappers. You take cover in a ruin to avoid friendly fire and two French soldiers come into your sight on other sides of the entrance. Both of them are reloading. Oh wait, one of them is typing! Kaytexx: fifr pls help reload You press 3 on your keyboard to play the part, but then your realize, oh no! You didn't pick up the fife! You decide to- amongusr34textstory: follow me i will boost behind house Ok, that works too genius. The French soldier finishes his reload and follows you behind the house. He shoots around the corner into a Russian and gets back into cover. Kaytexx: boost me nnow pls You do not pull out your fife, but pull out your trusty sabre. You easily stab the French soldier multiple times before he has any chance to react. You're about to t-bag but hear a cocking of a musket behind you. You are ready to give up. Did the author run out of time or is he lazy now? You close your eyes and prepare for a minute of tea-bagging on your lifeless corpse until you hear a shot. But you're.. fine??? You look behind you and see the French man that was about to blast you is lying on the ground. A Russian is next to him reloading on his corpse. Processing the situation, but you have no time to react as attackr164 jumps into the officer, he stabs the officer 2 times but is shot and instantly killed at close range... You pull out your sabre out of your endless pocket and stab the officer dead. The French are retreating. Your allies charge through the ruins and mow down the enemies in their back. You join in and shoot a straggler. But then you go from joy to agony. (edited)

billy big balls 12/25/2022 5:15 PM
The time has come. What you've all been waiting for, will go down in Blood and Iron history as the most canonical of all universes. BEHOLD.... DIE CHEGG... PART 2!!!! After leaving off with Zoe and our dashing hero Aeigh, the Austrians want their blood-thirsty revenge after the murder of their beloved and devilish Count von Maximilianerberhardtwilhelmusgoerlitzscheitzhaus. Reprisals are taken against prisoners of war who were formerly in the service of the Bavarians, as well as looting and plummeting any village to the ground suspected sympathetic to the Bavarians. An Expeditionary Corps is set out to eliminate the Austrian salient controlling the main road to an occupied Bavarian supply depot, with Bruce Aeigh and Zoe leading the Corps filled with veterans and conscripts alike, all eager to complete their only objective... defeat the brutal Austrians and regain the depot to supply their main push towards a counter-attack near the town of Groninghuecken. May God be with the Bavarians

[CBAI] SLave Slapster57 12/25/2022 5:38 PM

15
billy big balls 12/25/2022 5:42 PM
The cannons rolled heavily, groaning as their wheels rumbled along the road to Schustern, a small-town and an important supply area for military troops alike. At the head of the cannon, Bavarian troops marched smartly as their footsteps rung out in symphony. And at the head of the troops, mounted on a Grey steed was none other than Offizier Bruce Aeigh and his wonderful fiancee (see Die Chegg Part One for context.) Both were extremely honored and determined to carry out this Expedition, as the Austrians were devastating their communities, which had their relatives and friends, many of whom were slaughtered needlessly. "Zoe, pass me my scope please dear." asked Aeigh. She dutifully handed it to him, as he extended it and looked to the hills. "That's where we should be in 10 or so minutes. We can set up our artillery and direct a view towards Schustern." he noted. "Right you are my dear, I'll notify the Leutnant then." said Zoe as she gave him a peck on the cheek and dismounted to pass the order to the head of the artillery. Bruce chuckled and clicked his horse a bit forward to reconnaisse the area. "Awfully beautiful and quiet," he said in his head. "Perfect for a picnic after a war in some sorts... and a bit of tomfoolery." He nudged his horse a bit forward to check out the area. As he did, he noticed a dirt path, wide enough for artillery and supplies to pass by, that led into the forest. Bruce dismounted for a moment and looked ahead. It was a bit dark inside, but what if it was to be a shortcut?
billy big balls 12/25/2022 5:54 PM
Bruce turned his head the other way to the main road. "But what about the artillery..." he thought to himself. "If I split them, it may lighten the load for our troops, but we don't know what will be ahead." Aeigh remounted his horse and went back to the train of troops, motioning his officers and Zoe. "Did you see something Herr Offizier?" asked Berlecht, his trusted companion and Feldwebel of the Jagerisch Bayern. "Yes Berlecht. I saw a possible shortcut of sorts, and it may be essential into helping us get to Schustern faster to surprise the Austrians. However, there is the risk of running into armed brigands or even Austrian infantrymen scrounging around in there, and we won't have the proper cover. On the other hand, there is the main road we could keep on going, but it will be undoubtedly slower if we are to maintain the train in it's current condition." explained Aeigh. "Sorry if it's a bit too much to understand." Berlecht assured the Captain that it was of no worries. "How shall we proceed then?" he asked. Bruce turned his horse and looked out once more to the path and then the main road. 1Ô∏è‚É£ Lead your troops and artillery through the path through the forest 2Ô∏è‚É£ Continue down the main road as you were 3Ô∏è‚É£ Lead your infantry through the forest, and direct the artillery to continue down the main road @Text Story Text story hot and ready, come and get it fresh and steady

31
billy big balls 1/25/2023 1:21 AM
Bruce nodded his head slowly. "Alright then, I think it's best we go through the forest. But keep the men alert, we don't know what's going to be in there." He nudged his horse and he started ahead with Zoe. The troops fell out of their formation and formed marching lines on the perimeter of the supply wagons and cannons. The command is given, and they march into the dimly lit forest. As they go along the disheveled path, Zoe nudges Bruce. "You think this won't end up bad? It's troublesome enough that we have the artillery to watch out for..." Bruce nodded. "I know... but at this rate, it's either getting to the Depot as fast as possible or we end up all dead for nothing." Zoe nodded at this and they continued on in thought. Suddenly, a shot was fired. Everyone scrambled to their positions and the convoy was in alarm. "POSITIONS! THE ENEMY IS UPON US!" yelled a panicked officer. Bruce hopped off his horse with his flintlock in hand whilst running up and down the formation. "HOLD FIRE UNTIL YOU SIGHT THE ENEMY! DO NOT FIRE PREMATURELY!" he ordered. The formation held fire as silence filled the air once more. A minute passes before a soldier meekishly speaks "Sir, I might have not had the opportunity to say that I seem to have misfired my rifle." Everyone groaned at him in frustration while Bruce took the opportunity to give him a Rock eyebrow stare. He shrugged in disappointment and turned around to file back in their marching formation. The bullet struck him dead in the back of his skull. As the private fell with blood splattered over the dirt, more shots were fired and soldiers and horses alike were struck and fell. "TAKE COVER!" yelled Bruce as he rushed behind a tree. Soldiers fired blankly into the bushline and a few groans could be heard, yet still more shots rang out from the invisible enemy.
1:21 AM
"SIR, THE HORSES ARE GETTING SHOT! WHAT MUST WE DO?!" yelled an orderly behind a cart. Bruce fired his flintlock in no apparent aimed direction in anger. 1Ô∏è‚É£ Regroup the soldiers and have them cover the artillery towards their objective 2Ô∏è‚É£ Send the artillery off with little to no cover 3Ô∏è‚É£ Make a stand at the open area 4Ô∏è‚É£ Attempt a bayonet charge @Text Story Fresh off the press for your enjoyment. I'll be sure to have the next one ready much faster

Troy_TaleDisCourage 3/15/2023 3:17 PM
Ladies and gentlemen, and all in between, it is time for something new, and something fresh. after this place lay dormant for nearly two months, I have tasked myself with giving you something more than enjoyment, more than entertainment. I want to to make you encouraged, at the edge of your seat, and ready to read each segment the moment they arrive. So, with that being said, we start our first vote on what we shall place ourselves in; but wait, we need a name! - It Only Takes Lead - Ones Thy Left - Heads and Steel - Pick Your Own (DM Me the name and it will be included in the next vote if I favor it) Now that we are done with that, we need to give ourselves a setting. I have selected three favorable settings for our story here today. Take your pick wisely, for you cannot go back into the past. - Iberian Harbor: A unique land with plenty of places of interest, and an undying hunger for skirmishing. ‚Äç - Spanish Farmstead: Such a place many you and I know, and such an area for not just our partisan pvpers, but our "peace preachers". Ô∏è - Halberstadt: This menacing, towering, yet quiet and mysterious battlefield lays the challenge of more urban combat. And let's not forget campers - Falenty: Not so much of a likeable map to many, butI favor it for it's different areas of interest, from skirmishing in the forest, to stopping lines from the city with artillery, and even the swamp ranges down low, ready for the cavalry to strike. So, I ask you this. Are you ready to face your choices? To think outside of the box? To kill, plunder, and survive? Only one way to find out, follow this story as it goes along, and you shall see how you meet your fate. @Text Story

Troy_TaleDisCourage 3/16/2023 6:32 PM
Welcome back, travelers! I guess I must remain a man of my word and continue what I have started. Although the votes are bugged (It is showing two sets of votes), the results are the same. So now that we have our results, I guess it is time to move to the next vote. Name Result: Heads and Steel Map Result: Halberstadt Ô∏è This is where things get interesting, folks. We have the name of our adventure, and our setting. Now we need our characters. So why not pick our team? Westphalia: Their blue and white uniforms, while very easy to spot, remain delicate and unique to any other nation, giving them their own style and design for when in the field. Brunswick: Brunswick keeps a more simplistic style, mostly going for blacks and greys, while still having small amounts of color. What they lack in physique, they are strong in strategy. To keep this simple, I leave the vote as is. Which side are you going to join? Will it be the swift, accurate, powerful strategists from Brunswick? Or will it be the style, power, camping strats and the seemingly superior warriors from Westphalia. How will you continue to decide your fate? @Text Story

Troy_TaleDisCourage 3/17/2023 5:13 PM
So, traveler, this is your choice? You will join the Brunswick Ducal Corps for your potentially final fight? Well, that's great! Thankfully, in Blood and Iron, you will never have a last fight, so this will just be another one for you. Anywho, back to business. Now that you are enlisted, your next step is regiment assignment. Obviously, since you picked a boring non-cav and non-arty map, we are limited to choices. Thankfully, there are a few regiments open for you. 1Ô∏è‚É£ - 3. Linienbataillon (Line Infantry Ranker) - Seems like you just want to be a normie with the rest of 'em. 2Ô∏è‚É£ - Gardebataillon (Sapper) - Who knows? Maybe soup building is right for you. 3Ô∏è‚É£ - Avantgarde-Bataillon (Light Infantry Ranker) - Aha!, Some skirmishing should do you right good, maybe you actually have the competence and accuracy for it. 4Ô∏è‚É£ - Jagerkompaniee (Rifleman Ranker) - So, apparently you are egotistical enough to think you have the patience for probably the slowest Blood and Iron mechanic (other than round delayers). By all means, go ahead. - 3. Troy_TaleDisCourage 3/21/2023 9:30 PM
Heads and Steel, Chapter 2 Fallen Never Falter Bettercaulsall was a really good persuader. He had been in the army for a few months, nothing long and nothing crazy. What he truly had been, was a great thinker. His plans always turned out well, even in the craziest circumstances like this one. You look at him, a light bulb lit in your head. His plan seemed to be the way to go through this fight. The enemy had two lines, one on each road, and a large group of unorganized line infantry in the middle. If you reached a booth, you and your allies could easily take out a few of them. There is an issue about this strategy, though. There are six of them out there, and only four of you here. Only three have muskets, and even with a swift reload speed, your chances are still low if they charge with their sabres. Your thought process was interrupted when you looked at the chat for a swift moment. {Team} Bettercaulsall: WATCH OUT THEYRE CHARGING *ArgonBaronCarbon: *Go go go, theyre vulnerable! Your plan is seemingly halted, as there are now six men charging at your group, ready to slaughter you like they have done your fallen comrades. You, Yulaie, and Sall take aim at three of them, and take them out. Your reloads will not be quick enough, so you draw sabres. They got closer, and you could feel adrenaline pumping in your non-existent lego veins. You give a nod to Yulaie, and then Sall, and you brace forward, as Gerald draws his sabre, as his music stops. Then, two of them fall, shot by someone behind you. You and your group turn around to see a rifleman and a Gardebataillon ranker standing at the doorways of your chapel. (edited)
9:34 PM
Charles622007: I got you, kill the last one! Joseph_Stalling1953: Watch out hes behind u You, Yulaie, and Gerald each take a simultaneous swing at the final guy, and he goes down without a fight. You run up to Charles and Joseph and fist bump them both, even though, quite frankly, you can‚Äôt do that in this game. But, oh well, it‚Äôs my story, we will pretend. You finally begin your plan, as you, Charles, Joseph, Gerald, Yulaie, and Sall, now a great team of seven, reach the booths in the middle. You all reload and watch the two lines along the roads. They were the only enemies standing in your way of the Westphalian citadel that lies ahead. You decide to pop a few volleys of rounds at the line, killing and wounding a few of them. A small shootout occurs, and goes well until‚Ä¶ Bettercaulsall: I got shot‚Ä¶ BAI_TextStoryUser: WHAT!? You rush over to try and help him, but sadly, there are no medics. He hands you what seems to be a photo of a husky dog, himself, and what seems to be his non-existent wife. He also hands you a chain he had been wearing since his first battle. It was purely gold. He gave a goodbye, and shut his eyes, as he lost a pulse. Your emotions took over, and in a fit of rage, charged at one of the lines. Charles and Gerald came to support you, and after killing four of them, they were forced to retreat. You have somehow killed 3 people without taking damage, quite impressive. Now you face more choices. - You stick with Charles and Gerald, and leave the others behind as you sneak through the alleyways on the right to flank the enemy. - You regroup with the others, but leave Charles behind, since he is sticking to the flank idea. You and your other comrades will charge the Chapel. - You abandon all of them and move back to your headquarters to get reinforcements. - You attempt to disguise yourself as an enemy. Thank you for being patience everyone, I will try to get these out faster. Enjoy! @Text Story

Troy_TaleDisCourage 3/29/2023 5:53 PM
Heads and Steel, Chapter 3 The Resurgence is Pestilence Gerald and Charles were moving away from the main group, and seeing how they were willing to help you, rather than them, you choose to accompany this duo as you make your way to a large housing. You enter and check it out. Empty. This was unusual, considering the constant urban attacks, and campers that laid around Halberstadt often. Charles points out what seems to be a barricaded door. You brace, as he begins slashing down this Gabion with his sabre. He breaks down the Gabion and the three of you rush in with your weapons. Nobody. Now all three of you were terrified. ‚ÄúWhat if this was a trap?‚Äù ‚ÄúWhere did this come from?‚Äù These questions would stay on your minds as long as you remained in the structure. You three exited the building, and immediately spotted an AFK sapper, who was in the process of building a soup shop. After killing him, you took a glare at his soup shop. It was actually quite impressive, and could even be compared to the architecture of the backside of these buildings. You continue advancing until you reach a huge pile of crates. You attacked them, but nothing changed. They might be a part of the map. You and your friends continue until you see, what is to be, a nightmare. Gerald started playing his drum out of fear, and Charles handed you something. ‚ÄúSince we are practically doomed, take this.‚Äù It was a poem he had been given by his commander. It read: Brunswick, Oh Valiant Merciless armies, thou lead to the south artilleries, thy order, razing the grounds. General, thou voice command through shout, My liege, it is time thy bring out the hounds! Soldiers!, we fight thee, but for one cause, warriors, we win, cause thee never so brilliant! Brothers, draw sabres, attack thee with no pause We, a family, for Brunswick, Oh Valiant!
5:54 PM
You read it, despite the approaching force. Your vision began to blur, as if you could not see. You were becoming dizzy, nauseous, unable to comprehend what is in front of you. Three of your allies come to help, seeing the onslaught in front. You all take cover, so you can recover your senses. What do you see? - A group of five riflemen with two sappers. - A line of ten line infantry, including one officer. - An army of 7 buglers. @Text Story Sorry that this one took over a week. I was sick, hence the name of the chapter. Hope you enjoy this one, and I promise that if you dont pick bugler I will make the next one longer!
