Troy_TaleDisCourage 4/10/2023 9:36 PM
Heads and Steel, Chapter 4 Sound Adjutant‚Äôs Call! Your ears began to ring as the sound of several, disorganized, unintelligible sounds went through your head. ‚ÄúWhat the hell are they playing?" You peek over to look at the buglers, and it seems like they found your crew. You look over to your comrades, and then to Charles. You command Gerald to play his drums. Despite the seven oncoming buglers, his drums seemed to override the tunes. Your group simultaneously takes aim, and waits for them to get a bit closer. And then, the true nightmare. Zebra Strategy. They start zig-zagging, spinning, and weaving around in seemingly impossible manners. Sadly, this is Blood and Iron, so who are we to talk about realism? Anyways, you fire the first shot, and knock one right in the head. He goes down without another note. Suddenly, 6 bugles turned into 6 sabres and they were charging faster than ever. Charles and one of your allies, both take the next shots. (edited)
9:38 PM
Your ally, Conspirator_Hydra, or Sinful as you know, gets a clean headshot on the closest bugler. Charles hits the farthest one, right in his right shin, but due to range he does not fall. With no time to reload, you draw sabres and brace. Sinful rushes forward, attacking two of the four buglers at once with his sword. The buglers attack him viciously, getting two clean hits on him and forcing him back, after he mercilessly takes the head off of the first one. You, Charles, Gerald, and your other ally all moved forward to match the intensity of your injured comrade. You go to swing at the limping bugler whom Charles shot previously, hoping to get an easy kill. Boom! Your ally was shot by a no-good rifleman who was using the buglers for their buff. Suddenly, this fight turns for the worst. You take out the poor wounded soul, as Charles and Gerald take on the bulk of the group, allowing Sinful to get a reload in. As the buglers go down, the rifleman is somehow ready for his next shot. ‚ÄúJust like the wild west‚Äù you would ponder, as you prayed that Sinful was out on top. Click Click! You watch, as both of them retain aim. It was quite silent for several seconds, the suspense increasing and your nerves riled up. Boom! Boom! The riflemen goes down! But wait‚Ä¶ Who did he shoot? You look around frantically, until you see your mighty drummer, fallen lifelessly beside you. Your mind goes into a panic, as you shout and scream in anger. You cry in fear. You pray in guilt. You point to Sinful, who was reloading and just trying to survive, thankful that they did not falter from a mere rifleman. {Team} BAI_TextStoryUser: WHY DID U LET HIM DIE U COULDVE SHOT HIM FIRST {Team} Conspirator_Hydra: I didn‚Äôt know whom he would shoot, you cannot blame me! Toxicityismyfather: bro who the hell are these ############ I hate blood and iron bro (edited)
9:39 PM
After a moment of silence for your comrade, the three of you made sure you were prepared. Ammo for the task. Muskets at the ready. Sabres sharp and bloodied. Minds at the focus of hand. You tell your allies to #########################. Oh, wait, sorry, Roblox filter. You try again, and alert your allies of the fxnivxe gxuys over there, because they have fxnivxe muskets and can kxll you. Much better. You decide that making a plan is necessary, since you do not have the manpower to take on a 5-man anymore. Sinful offers the plan of skirmishing from a distance. Three shots, three kills. This allows your group to eliminate a portion of their strength, and maybe make the fight in melee. Charles disagrees. He thinks we should regroup with allies and make a charge on their main building. If we kill the five soldiers there, we can breach their citadel and most likely end up victorious, seeing as how the battle seems to be slowing down anyway. You can‚Äôt think of a plan, but you go with Sinful‚Äôs idea, as it seems to be the swiftest and most efficient for this scenario. With this in mind, the three of you advance to some cover, and draw muskets. You take aim at the group, but you are spotted. Thankfully, they were not ready to strike first. You each get a headshot on the three closest assailants, and take cover to reload. Here comes the flaw in his plan: reinforcements. Suddenly, two more guys come out of the door and the group unsheaths their melees. One of them, a sapper, carried a mighty axe. This now leaves you with only a few choices. Ô∏è - Surrender, no point in fighting anymore, they outnumber you by a wide margin and you have no reason to fight. - Reload, take your chances, maybe they are too slow and you can get another shot in. Ô∏è - Draw sabres and take on the group with full force! (Poor Sinful) @Text Story Apologies for the wait, I promised this would be longer! Thank you @carbon and @Frenda (@Conspirator_Hydra)!

giantsquad 6/11/2023 1:04 PM
Yet again, this soldier's fate will end up being entirely up to your imagination, as @Troy_TaleDisCourage will be unable to continue. I thank them for their contributions while we open our next @Text Story. That being said, we have one major change in mind, and I can thank @Wynn_Sol for the idea. Instead of sticking in one channel, #text-stories would become a forum-based activity, with multiple @Writers narrating the lives of a variety of characters, allowing you, the reader, to experience multiple stories simultaneously, in different universes. You could be in the boots of a brave Bavarian one minute, then explore the emotion of an alternate Frenchman another. Writers could even team up in a way not seen before, with multiple stories featuring characters all fighting the same fight, displaying numerous perspectives in many writing styles. This is, of course, only if you as the reader would like to see something like this in effect. Take time to consider both sides, although I do wholeheartedly encourage you to at least give this a shot. With more stories comes more pings, and more scenarios to keep track of (if that's something you do), but it also refreshens the channel with a greater frequency of published segments and enriches the experience for both reader and all the writers, who no longer have to wait their turn for months or years to display their skills. Your vote decides the way this goes. Thanks, @giantsquad @deleted-role If you would like to try this out, react with a . If you would like to stick with the current format of just one story, react with a . (edited)
140
11
giantsquad pinned a message to this channel. 6/11/2023 1:12 PM
giantsquad 6/12/2023 12:48 PM
@Text Story Okay, so the vote is pretty unanimous, and I'll implement this new format soon. On that note, if you would like to join what shall hopefully be a more active writing team, dm me. Once the new forum channel is put in, this will be archived. If you've already dm'ed me and for some reason I never responded, I apologize. Try sending another message and I'll do my best to respond as I have time. (edited)
Zed 11/22/2023 4:24 PM
@Text Story @Writer Hey folks, due to months of inactivity I've just gone and restored the old format here. New writers can still be chosen with a quick DM of me or another admin. Any current writers who wish to start a new story can do so immediately, just make sure to convene with your fellow writers on who goes first, details, etc. Looking forward to future stories!

CATCATCATCATCATCATCATCATCATCAT 1/20/2024 7:43 PM
dropping in 8 hours
CATCATCATCATCATCATCATCATCATCAT 1/21/2024 2:40 AM
make that 7
2:40 AM
Ambush them. You have no doubt about running behind the trees. It's almost like it's in your subconscious at this point. Honestly, why wouldn't you? You've only been pussying out for the whole match. The shrill tunes start to get closer and closer. You actually have to fight back now. You hatch a plan. You'll wait for them to walk past you, and pick them off when their backs are turned. Simple, but effective. You present your pistol, making sure that not even a single pixel of your character is able to be seen by the enemies. You swivel your camera around in third person to see if any of them are close by. As you scan the surroundings, you spot a lone fifer, heading straight towards you. He's switching between his sword and his instrument, as if preparing for an ambush. However, he seems to be oblivious to your presence. Your hands tremble in anticipation as he moves nearer. The fifer unknowingly walks into your kill range. Checkmate. Without hesitation, you pop out from behind the tree trunk, and shoot him in the face. His body slumps to the ground, lifeless. You've just killed one of them. Looks like you aren't good-for-nothing, after all. You start your reload, moving around as you continue to survey the foggy woodland. You see the bodies of your fallen comrades, scattered all over the floor. The air is filled with a deafening silence after you reload. It's like even the enemy fifers have stopped playing, just to share this moment of mourning with you. Oh fuck. The fifers. You spin around to see all 3 of them, running towards you at light speed. Their swords are drawn, stained with the blood of your friends. You immediately ready your pistol, aiming at the fifer closest to you. He doesn't seem to realise you have a gun. Mercilessly, you fire at him. He falls. However, the other fifers are unafraid. They continue charging after you, hungry for your flesh. It doesn't matter, though. One is dead. Two more to go...
2:40 AM
@Text Story to be continued...
147
2:41 AM
yes thestory is ending
CATCATCATCATCATCATCATCATCATCAT 1/22/2024 2:54 AM
Two more to go. You switch to your sword, knowing that you wouldn't have time to make enough distance to reload. The fifers are still relentlessly chasing after you. You need help, but it seems like your teammates are more proactive now. [thanatos322]: One of them walked into water and he's red, other one full Knowing the enemies' HP, you feel your fighting instincts kicking in. Fuck it. If you lose, you lose. Expecting to catch the fifers off guard, you do a full 180 and run into them. Your blade slices into one of them, and he falls face first into the grass. (That was easy.) However, the remaining fifer manages to hit you with his sword. You're now a sneeze away from dying. You keep your camera focused on him, and... Wait, what's he doing? He's running away? Without a second thought, you switch to your pistol and reload. The chat goes wild. [thanatos322]: HOLY COW HE' SHIM [BigBuffOilyGentleme]: chat is this real [seriouslysaul]: WHAT ARE MY TEAMMATES DOING JUST CHARGE [Napoleon]: LOL THESE ENEMIES ARE SO BAD [thanatos322]: GOGOGOG As you finish your reload, you feel some motivation to do well again. The fire in you, that you had once thought was long gone, is starting to re-ignite. You quickly locate the last one, who is hiding behind a tree. You ready your pistol, forcing him away from it. He's starting to dodge in an irregular pattern, but you try to keep your crosshair trained on him. You're certain you can finish this round off with a bang. You glance up at the chat. [BigBuffOilyGentleme]: he's RED LOL You're suddenly reminded of your own mortality, and, in a panic, fire in the direction of the fifer. The anthem doesn't play. You missed. The fifer wastes no time in running at you, and cuts you down swiftly. FUCKFUCKFUCKFUCKFUCKFUCKFUCKFUCK You have died. You close ROBLOX out of sheer rage. This is the 13th time you've lost. This game is shit. Coding is shit. Playerbase is shit. Shit shit shit shit shit.
2:55 AM
Hey, wait! You got a new ping from the Blood and Iron Community. Seeing that it came from #text-stories , you're not angry anymore. It's time to settle down and read the new @Text Story. You then realise it's what happened to you last round. Shame.

billy big balls 1/22/2024 9:38 PM
Bruce x Zoe
billy big balls 1/27/2024 11:25 AM
today, I bring back an unfinished relic that was a sequel to the original Bruce Aeigh x Zoe lore that disappeared in the annals of Blood and Iron history.... and today, it shall be brought to life
11:27 AM
Synopsis: After leaving off with Zoe and our dashing hero Aeigh, the Austrians want their blood-thirsty revenge after the murder of their beloved and devilish Count von Maximilianerberhardtwilhelmusgoerlitzscheitzhaus. Reprisals are taken against prisoners of war who were formerly in the service of the Bavarians, as well as looting and plummeting any village to the ground suspected sympathetic to the Bavarians. An Expeditionary Corps is set out to eliminate the Austrian salient controlling the main road to an occupied Bavarian supply depot, with Bruce Aeigh and Zoe leading the Corps filled with veterans and conscripts alike, all eager to complete their only objective... defeat the brutal Austrians and regain the depot to supply their main push towards a counter-attack near the town of Groninghuecken. May God be with the Bavarians
11:29 AM
The cannons rolled heavily, groaning as their wheels rumbled along the road to Schustern, a small-town and an important supply area for military troops alike. At the head of the cannon, Bavarian troops marched smartly as their footsteps rung out in symphony. And at the head of the troops, mounted on a Grey steed was none other than Offizier Bruce Aeigh and his wonderful fiancee (see Die Chegg Part One for context.) Both were extremely honored and determined to carry out this Expedition, as the Austrians were devastating their communities, which had their relatives and friends, many of whom were slaughtered needlessly. "Zoe, pass me my scope please dear." asked Aeigh. She dutifully handed it to him, as he extended it and looked to the hills. "That's where we should be in 10 or so minutes. We can set up our artillery and direct a view towards Schustern." he noted. "Right you are my dear, I'll notify the Leutnant then." said Zoe as she gave him a peck on the cheek and dismounted to pass the order to the head of the artillery. Bruce chuckled and clicked his horse a bit forward to reconnaisse the area. "Awfully beautiful and quiet," he said in his mind. "Perfect for a picnic after a war in some sorts... and a bit of tomfoolery." He nudged his horse a bit forward to check out the area. As he did, he noticed a dirt path, wide enough for artillery and supplies to pass by, that led into the forest. Bruce dismounted for a moment and looked ahead. It was a bit dark inside, but what if it was to be a shortcut?
11:31 AM
Bruce turned his head the other way to the main road. "But what about the artillery..." he thought to himself. "If I split them, it may lighten the load for our troops, but we don't know what will be ahead." Aeigh remounted his horse and went back to the train of troops, motioning his officers and Zoe. "Did you see something Herr Offizier?" asked Berlecht, his trusted companion and Feldwebel of the Jagerisch Bayern. "Yes Berlecht. I saw a possible shortcut of sorts, and it may be essential into helping us get to Schustern faster to surprise the Austrians. However, there is the risk of running into armed brigands or even Austrian infantrymen scrounging around in there, and we won't have the proper cover. On the other hand, there is the main road we could keep on going, but it will be undoubtedly slower if we are to maintain the train in it's current condition." explained Aeigh. "Sorry if it's a bit too much to understand." Berlecht assured the Captain that it was of no worries. "How shall we proceed then?" he asked. Bruce turned his horse and looked out once more to the path and then the main road. 1Ô∏è‚É£ Lead your troops and artillery through the path through the forest 2Ô∏è‚É£ Continue down the main road as you were 3Ô∏è‚É£ Lead your infantry through the forest, and direct the artillery to continue down the main road @Text Story come feast your eyes and make smart decisions for this delicious story
32
19
207
billy big balls 2/10/2024 11:35 PM
Bruce sighed for a moment. Then he nodded and spoke, "Feldwebel. Instruct the artillery to continue down the main road. We'll link up with them somehow after the forest." Berlecht nodded, "Right away sir." He gave immediate orders to the cannoneers to advance forward down the road. Officers of the Corps immediately directed their soldiers into a fresh marching formation through the forest and led them down. Bruce led the formation along with Zoe. "My dear, I do not have such a good feeling about this shortcut we are taking," Zoe said. Bruce gave a curt nod. "Whatever is done has been done. I'll make sure to post scouts up ahead to soothe your worries." Bruce whistled for Berlecht who came up to him immediately. "Send forward scouts to secure the area around us. I don't have a good feeling of what's up ahead." Berlecht saluted, and as he did, the sound of a musket rang out as if on cue of Aeigh's statement. A groan was heard and Berlecht slumped over off the horse. "MUSKET FIRE!" yelled a soldier, and a barrage of musket fire followed right after, cutting down individual soldiers on the flanks. "PROTECTIVE FORMATION, PROTECTIVE FORMATION!" yelled Bruce and the soldiers began closing ranks while blindly firing into the forest to remove the threat. Zoe immediately tended to Berlecht who seemed to have been shot in the hip. He groaned in agony. "Augh... are the Austrians... in the forest?" he asked. Zoe consoled him and bid him not to speak while she tried wrapping him with cloth. More shots from the tree lines zipped by and cut down more soldiers. "SIR, SIR!" a Corporal yelled. "WHAT ARE WE GOING TO DO?! THEY'RE EVERYWHERE AND WE DON'T SEE THEM!" "SIR, THE HORSES ARE GETTING SHOT! WHAT MUST WE DO?!" yelled an orderly behind a cart. Bruce fired his pistol from behind his horse in anger.
11:37 PM

billy big balls started a thread. 2/10/2024 11:48 PM
CATCATCATCATCATCATCATCATCATCAT 2/11/2024 8:02 AM
the story gonna end in 4 parts
billy big balls 2/17/2024 1:36 PM
"REGROUP THE MEN! REGROUP THEM ALL AND HAVE THEM BACK TO BACK IN FIRING FORMATION!" Bruce yelled out loud. The men began to organize under fire and with their backs to one another, fired into the trees with a decent effect. The enemies' fire was less considerable but shots still rang out while cutting the Bavarian Corps' manpower bit by bit. After what seemed like long minutes of back and forth shooting, musket fire ceased to come from the trees and Bruce ordered a cease fire. The casualties were counted and a good 47% out of 100% of the Bavarian Expeditionary Corps were either found killed or wounded. "What a waste," Zoe said disappointingly. "All that from a well-covered enemy." While she remounted her horse, Bruce gathered all of his uninjured officers and discussed their next course of action. "Gentlemen, we have suffered casualties as you can see. However, we still have a manageable size of our force intact plus the artillery up on the main road, so we must do what we can to reach Schustern and take it as a supply point for the main army behind us. Send out some of our Jaegers amongst the forest beside our main column and advance our column at the double. We're not going to be ambushed like we have been this time." The officers saluted and carried out the orders. Bruce remounted his horse alongside Zoe and sighed. "What's wrong my love?" asked Zoe. "My dear, is it unrealistic for us to take the town as we are? We've lost a lot of good men and I wouldn't be surprised if we attacked Schustern that the whole Austrian army was waiting for us to crush us under their ghastly teeth," Bruce replied. Zoe scoffed,"Is that the Bruce Aeigh I know? The same Bruce Aeigh that saved me from Count von Maximilianerberhardtwilhelmusgoerlitzscheitzhaus and his bloody grenadiers? The cunning Bruce Aeigh who swiftly dealt a blow to the Austrian Army in Unterlaichling? I refuse to believe that."
billy big balls 2/17/2024 1:48 PM
Bruce tried to speak but Zoe put a finger to his lip and said, "Get us out of this forest first then we can talk what to do next. Think Bruce, think of your talent and how to use it to help keep Bavaria off the hands of these Austrians who killed my family... please..." she said with a slight but hidden tear falling down her cheek. Bruce patted her cheek gingerly and nodded. "Right." he cleared his throat. He nodded to his waiting men and waved the column on to march. After thirty-five minutes of marching, the army finally arrived to the outskirts of the forest and saw the slight outline of Schustern beyond the forest. The Bavarian rank-and-file gave hearty cheers and tipped their hats off to Bruce, relieved to have gotten out alive while the others couldn't have. "RIGHT! Let's see if the artillery is here and we'll prepare our attack plan in a moment's time. Prepare camp and set up pickets." Bruce ordered. Camp was set up and the soldiers settled down for their supper while the long-awaited artillery began arriving and promptly prepared their firing positions for the attack to come. While all the preparations were occuring, there was a commotion in the camp. Bruce and his orderly came immediately to investigate and came across a large body of his soldiers gathered in a crowd. "MAKE WAY!" he ordered as he pushed amongst his men and came to discover an Austrian Grenzer, bloody and beaten up. "DISPERSE AT ONCE AND LEAVE THE MAN! WE MIGHT NEED HIM!" he bellowed as his veteran Jaegers helped clear the crowd and formed a cordon around the Grenzer. Bruce knelt down and asked, "Who are you and how did you come across my camp?" The Grenzer stuttered for a moment in surprise but finally said, "I'm just a Grenzer... your men caught me in the forest with no weaponry." Bruce remarked, "Quite the luck to fall into my Corps while you killed many of them in a well-executed attack, eh?"
1:54 PM
The Grenzer shuddered but said nothing. Bruce continued, "Look, as much as I like being courteous to my men to letting them have the proper justice with you, I am willing to spare your life if you are certain of any knowledge in the actions of your army in Schustern. Would you be willing to?" The Grenzer still said nothing. "Well?" asked Bruce once again. The Grenzer finally cracked a grin and slowly laughed. "What's so funny you damn Grenzer? Speak!" Bruce said to him visibly annoyed. "YOU'RE ALL GOING TO DIE!!! YOU ARE ALL GOING TO DIE! YOU AND YOUR PITIFUL CORPS WILL NEVER LIVE TO SEE THE LIGHT OF DAY WHEN WE FINISH YOU OFF AT SCHUSTERN!" the Grenzer burst out laughing like a maniac. Bruce stood there for a moment then stepped back while his men who overheard the rant of the quite mentally disturbed Austrian began descending on him and beating the ever-loving shit out of him. Bruce returned to his tent with a few of his Captains and began discussing the attack. "Quite an episode, was it not sir?" mentioned one of them and Bruce nodded. "It was so, but let's get to the matter on hand. We have the artillery and the decent manpower to take Schustern if we do not face considerable resistance from the Austrians, but how are we to approach this? The main army is still some ways behind us but their main force may meet up with us by, say, tomorrow afternoon if we hold off our attack on Schustern. Your thoughts, gentlemen?" 1Ô∏è‚É£ Wait for the reconnoitering force of the main Bavarian army to arrive and assist you at Schustern 2Ô∏è‚É£ Order a bombardment of Schustern to soften up the town for the attack to come 3Ô∏è‚É£ Carry out the attack with your entire Corps at dawn 4Ô∏è‚É£ Infiltrate the town to reconnoiter the Austrian positions @Text Story

billy big balls 2/28/2024 6:05 PM
One of the captains spoke up, "Sir, I think that with the amount of men we lost, we should hold off the attack and receive our reinforcements from the reconnaissance force ahead of the main army and then we should consider attacking." A few of the officers nodded at this suggestion. Bruce sighed, "Have you any idea on the time of their arrival?" The captain shook his head from side to side, indicating his no. The tent was silent for a minute until a junior officer spoke up. "Mr. Aeigh, why not use the artillery to bombard the town? Perhaps it can help us diminish the Austrian forces' numbers in Schustern and we could attack more easily." Bruce thought for a moment and then spoke, "Sounds like a good plan. However, there's a flaw to the artillery attack and that is the risk of losing the town's supplies to the bombardment. Do you have any counter measures to that or no?" The junior officer sighed and said no. Bruce however nodded, "I suppose anything helps. We'll establish temporary supply depots after the bombardment." He began writing notes on slips of papers and handed them out to the officers. "Pass this out to the artillery crews and begin the bombardment 6 am, sharp at dawn." The officers saluted and marched out. 6 am. Sharp. The yells of the artillery crew ring out in the silence of the air. The cannons are loaded and then.... KABOOOOOOOM!! The bombardment has begun. The cannons fire in a fusillade into Schustern, waking up the Austrians in the town and obliterates the forward buildings in the area. The cannonading continues on and on for an hour or so until the artillery reports they are low on ammunition. Bruce and his officers gather around and survey the damage from afar with their telescopes. "Let us go forth gentlemen, for Bavaria." The officers saluted and began assembling the men.
billy big balls 2/28/2024 7:35 PM
Bruce gathered his horse and met Zoe before all the men. "My love, I suppose we shall do this battle together as we have always done." Zoe smirked and him and teased "Oh Bruce you flirt, just promise me you'll stay alive." She brought him forth and they pressed their lips together in a kiss. The Bavarian Corps cheered wildly and raised their hat. "YOU BAGGED A BADDIE, HERR AEIGH!" "WISH I HAD A WOMAN LIKE THAT!" "Is this what future generations will call, skibidi gyatt fanum tax gronk rizz??" The couple finished kissing and Bruce proclaimed, "That is your battle speech lads. ON WE GO!" He raised his sword and pointed it to Schustern, and the musicians began to play. The Bavarian Corps began marching down the hill with the men singing Bavarian tunes and marching onto the town. Surprisingly, when they reached the ruins of the outskirts of Schustern, they had found lots of discarded equipment and dead Austrians. "You don't mean to tell me we finished them off that quick?" whispered a Bavarian corporal. The Corps marched towards the middle of the town until they came across an unexpected sight. There, the Austrian positions were fortified and muskets aimed straight at them. "SIR, THEY'RE ALIVE!" a voice rang out and a massive volley fired forth. Soldiers were cut down and horses flailed and yelled while Bruce was thrown off his horse. The Bavarians backed onto the walls while returning fire one by one. Bruce crawled over by the wall while frantically scanning around for Zoe. "WHERE IS SHE?! WHERE IS MY BELOVED??" he yelled while his men were firing at the positions. No reply was given when a swivel cannon was fired at them from the Austrian position and blasted near 3 men. Bruce, exasperated at this sudden turn of events, waved his sword back to the near outskirts of the town and gestured his men to retreat there. The bugler sounded the "Retreat!" call and the Bavarians fell out in order.
billy big balls 2/28/2024 7:52 PM
Once assembled by the outskirts, guards were posted near the centre of the town and fired intermittedly at the Austrians while Bruce was organizing the remainder of his men who have quite decreased with his officers. "We've got to think of something, fast. Those damn Austrians gave us a surprise but if we can manage to put up a strong fight against them, we may as well buy time for the reconnaissance force to arrive. A soldier looked back at Aeigh, "Sir, is your girl okay?" Bruce sighed, "I haven't seen her, why?" The soldier spoke, "I thought I saw a couple of Austrians corner her in a nearby building where a lot of us were killed." He pointed to a building near the positions of the Austrians, where a few were crowded outside the door trying to breach it. Bruce stood there for a second and then began to run to it before two burly Bavarian sappers tried to hold him back. "SIR, IT'S FUTILE! DO NOT GET YOURSELF KILLED!" "MY ZOE," yelled Bruce. "MY LOVE...." 1Ô∏è‚É£Organize what men you have left and attempt a full attack on the fortifications 2Ô∏è‚É£ Probe the area with your men for any weak points to cut the Austrians down 3Ô∏è‚É£ Attempt to rescue Zoe with the remainder of your men, perhaps you may find suitable cover from the building? 4Ô∏è‚É£ Make a position from where you are and await the reconnaissance force @Text Story someone draw an oc of the two of them already please please

billy big balls 3/9/2024 1:16 AM
Bruce took heavy breaths as he was being restrained by his sappers, realizing the futility of what might happen if they attempted to rescue Zoe. However he felt his heart shatter when he could not save her from the bastardous Austrians. "SIR, WHAT'S OUR NEXT STEP?!" yelled a corporal who organized a couple groups of men near Bruce. Bruce looked around and saw some abandoned alleys that did not seem blocked by the Austrians. "Let's find their weak-points, fast. I'd rather we all lose our lives and defeat the Austrians at the same time to clear the way for the main army." The men nodded their affirmatives and took positions along the walls as Aeigh lead them to the abandoned paths. While they witnessed the Austrians firing their muskets behind the barricades out of sight, they noted a broken path through to a supply warehouse along with a path that led to a large municipal building. "Let's take the alley to the warehouse. If we can resupply ourselves and break through a building behind their lines, we may as well bring something positive out of this situation." They marched along the alley and took a few minutes to reach the warehouse albeit safely. The Bavarian sappers breached the doors open to allow the men to find their proper supplies and arm themselves once more. As that was done, they immediately exited to take the path to the main square where the Austrians were held up. Creeping alongside a broken wall, Bruce looked around and then raised his sword. "GOD SAVE BAVARIA LADS!" The Bavarians raised their bayonets and uttered a fierce yell which would have scared any militia, mind you, and then rushed into the unsuspecting Austrians from the sides. Wild shots were fired as bayonets were rammed into bodies with screams filling the air as Bavarian vs Austrian took their savage duels to new heights. Bruce swang his sword and stabbed whatever Austrian he could come upon, giving them no quarter while thinking of his beloved Zoe who may have been dead.
billy big balls 3/9/2024 1:32 AM
"GRENADIERS! GRENADIERS!" yelled a soldier near Bruce, and soon enough, Austrian grenadiers stepped into positions, immediately filed into two firing ranks, and fired into the crowd of soldiers, irrespective of whether they were Bavarian or Austrians. Scores of men fell onto the ground either killed or wounded while survivors attempted to flee the chaos. "RETREAT, RETREA-" yelled Bruce. But suddenly, the yells of the Grenadiers became louder and louder until a gun stock appeared and cracked Aeigh in the head, knocking him out into the dark. A voice appeared in his head and a faint figure which looked like Zoe appeared, glimmering beautifully. "Bruce?... Bruce...?......" @Text Story End of Part 2. Thank you for reading the second installment of the Bruce x Aeigh storyline, and now it's being handed off to the next writer!

School's over, and you decide to hop on Blood & Iron with some of your friends. The five of you decide to join a crowded server; the current map is Hougoumont, but you can see from the round timer that a new one is about to start. You notice that the field guns on the map look a little different now... The round ends as the familiar French anthem shreds your fragile eardrums. The map disappears; four new options take its place on your screen. 1Ô∏è‚É£ Road to Smolensk [Beware of branches and the new howitzers! The classic partisan horde battle, with the Russian Empire pitted against the Duchy of Warsaw. This map is pretty empty, save for the ruins and forest which serve as the only infantry cover.] 2Ô∏è‚É£ Halberstadt [Peace or chaos? This one is Brunswick vs Westphalia--a good map to try out the update, since both teams just got some new uniforms! The buildings on their own are already a maze, so try to avoid going into them alone. Or don't. I'm not your dad.] 3Ô∏è‚É£ Wooded Crest [Hey, this map got a howitzer in the update! Make sure to watch out--you never know when a gigantic cannonball can delete you from the battle, since the thin treeline is the only thing preventing your detection by the enemy.] 4Ô∏è‚É£ El Bruch [This map has a lot of possibilities. You can use your legendary melee skills to grab a whole suite of epic god MLG sword kills for your Blood & Iron clip compilation later, flank around the side of the town, or go into the vineyard. You know that you can eat grapevines in real life? You should eat the grapevines.]

yadaCubed started a thread. 3/25/2024 9:31 AM
MegaAbsol (@jactonia123) 4/2/2024 12:06 AM
Welp! After a few moments (though for some reason it feels like several entire days), you come to the decision to pick the side of Austria‚Äîbecause, let's be serious, Austria got more regiment additions than the French. Also, fuck French people. You're taken directly to the class menu, and are faced with a variety of options to choose from: 1Ô∏è‚É£ Officer [Maybe you want to become a saber-waving commander and fulfill your lifelong dream of leading your men to an awful position where they will all die within seconds, glorious victory. Or maybe you just want to go full John Wick and do some pistol gaming! Either way, the Officer class is the choice for you.] 2Ô∏è‚É£ Line Infantry [Normal McNormalson. But hey‚Äîthe bayonet is pretty good, and you can do some decent damage with it (if you're competent)!] 3Ô∏è‚É£ Rifleman [You're (surprisingly) a pretty good marksman and can pop heads and take names with shocking regularity, but this might also make you a prime target for anyone on the other team with a gun to point at you.] 4Ô∏è‚É£ Light Infantry [Want to use a rifle, but hate the long reload? Run Light Infantry for a round! Let's just hope that you and your team have a basic understanding of ballistics. Please. For the love of God, please.] (edited)

You're stuck in a shitty situation; turning to fight might result in an embarrassing death, and continuing to run would look pretty cowardly. Just show the enemies you mean no harm.]

[CBAI] SLave Slapster57 8/4/2024 5:44 AM
You have chosen to head straight to the forest. You make up for lost time by beelining it to the treeline, marching forward with your pike outstretched and eyes open. It doesn't take you long to spot your first target. It's an Austrian hussar, sporting an ugly green jacket and ill-fitting blue feathered hat. He's an eyesore; you figure (like the sweaty, edgy little tryhard that you are) that getting rid of him will probably be doing him a favor. It's time to show this loser who's boss. As he speeds toward you, you quickly dart to his left‚Äîgetting out of the way of his sword. He whizzes right by you, but you don't manage to get a shot off on his horse with your pike in time‚Äîit's a slow weapon, and your ping isn't doing you any favors. No matter; he's turning back now for another run. This time, you don't bother dodging. It takes just one clean slice with the pike to knock out his horse, and now he's on the ground. Easy as pie. Wait. He has a better sword then you. How are you supposed to kill him, again? You try to use your pike's range to get a hit off on him before he can recover, but he responds by dicing you right back with his sword. You're both yellow, now, but with any luck you can‚Äî Is it just me, or do you hear the heavy clomping of another quartet of horse hooves behind you? Fuck. 1Ô∏è‚É£ Dodge left. [It's what you did with the first hussar, so it's gotta work again, right? Cavalry hold their weapons on the right, so naturally, dodging to the left should get you out of harm's way.] 2Ô∏è‚É£ Dodge right. [But what if, you think to yourself, the cavalryman is already on your left, and dodging right will instead get you out of their range? The clock is ticking‚Äîbetter make a decision quick.] 3Ô∏è‚É£ Hold still and accept your fate. [Feh. All of this thinking is giving you a migraine. What's the worst that could happen, anyway?] @Text Story (edited)

This guy is a real weirdo, isn't he? You can see welcometo6 approaching from the town‚Äîhe's a rifleman, like the total sweaty loser tryhard that he almost certainly is. As he nears the fortifications around the Austrian spawn, he makes ready and presents the rifle in your direction; you take cover behind an unoccupied horse, its saddle presumably left vacant from earlier skirmishing. You both stand there for a while. This is getting rather boring, isn't it? Reluctantly, you eventually break the mold and peek from behind the horse. You enable shiftlock, then run out the other side and start spazzing out like you're having a seizure. At last, you have it‚Äîhe fires and misses by a few inches. Now comes the real meat of this engagement.
3:05 AM
You both charge at each other, and you land a lucky first hit with the pike before switching to your sword bayonet. You pull it up to block his swing‚Äîjust in time, too; another few milliseconds and you would've been lying dead at his feet. The two of you are locked in a dance, circling and striking and parrying with focused, technical acumen; you are archrivals, worthy adversaries whose respect for one another has been forged through crossed swords and spilled blood‚Äîaaaaaaand then welcometo6 gets killed by a passing lancer. He rides off; it might even have been the same cavalryman from earlier. More out of instinct than any rational thought, you duck into the nearest building; you never get more than a few feet away from him as he runs you down. [CBAI] SLave Slapster57 9/3/2024 7:59 PM
You have chosen to surprise attack him at an opportune moment. As soon as the poor fifer stops moving to type, you charge forward with your sword bayonet and land a hit on him. He's taken by surprise; your Austrian opponent quickly sends his unfinished message in chat before taking any steps to retaliate. [2;37m[2;33m[ImperialEnf0rcer]:[0m[2;37m Oh look im BAI_TextStoryUser im wimpy and scared and a total RE You wonder for a moment what he was going to say there. Your train of thought is interrupted when he raises his sword to swing back at you, and you quickly block his strike. We're not going back to the corner, are we? You're smarter than this guy. You're highly intelligent, perceptive, technically skilled, and possess the decision-making capabilities of over 300 discord users fused together into some sort of mashed potato hivemind. You come up with a plan: you'll back into the corner again, make him think you're round delaying, and then‚Äîwhen he least expects it‚Äîland a final hit on him and win the day for Poland. You've hit him twice already, so it should all be over afterward. You reverse course, keeping up your block, and head back into the corner. If looks could kill, Austria would be well on its way to winning the round; the fifer is staring at you with the exact same beady-eyed intensity he's possessed for the last seven minutes, and yet to you his eyes make up for the fifer's lack of ranged armaments in full. He stops, and then it's time. You charge forward, sword drawn; his eyes widen, and for a moment his ocular muskets turn into ocular concavities, curving inward and away from your terrifying rush. The steel of your blade meets the gore of his flesh. Wait. You were slashing him with a sword bayonet. Three hits isn't enough. He's still alive! He taps you once with his melee, and then... You have died. You killed a total of 1 man, and he was an artilleryman. Git gud next time.

S_Terrence (@SilentShadowLegend) 9/4/2024 5:34 AM
Honestly... Skill issue
billy big balls 9/11/2024 10:34 PM
A fabled Blood & Iron-lored story has returned. The #text-stories has been graced with Part 3 of the Bruce Aeigh series, with this installment turning them into trilogies. Impressive. Now with even more action and impressive details and more critical thinking as to keep Bruce alive or suddenly kill him, the decisions are up to you all. Let's make this a hell of a text story. Synopsis: The disastrous assault on Schustern has failed. The Bavarian Expeditionary Corps is all but destroyed due to the perseverance of the Austrians to defeat their enemy even when the artillery seemed to cut their numbers. Now, there are many mangled, rotting, colorfully decorated dead bodies left in the allies and cobble-stoned streets of the town. Austrian Grenadiers, with their feared temperament and mettle in combat, could be seen marching in patrols of two along the almost destroyed down, bayonetting any wounded left alive. The Austrian regiments supporting the grenadiers look on in fear and awe. Now we wonder where Zoe is? We scan the area with our eyes and do not see her. She is nowhere to be seen. Now for Bruce. Not in the town either apparently. Wait. What‚Äôs that over there? Zoom out. Yes. Past the town there‚Ä¶ yes‚Ä¶ it does seem to look like a camp. Move forward‚Ä¶ forward‚Ä¶ oh dear. It is an internment camp. And by the fence‚Ä¶ there‚Äôs Bruce sitting down motionless‚Ä¶ what happened to him?! ‚ÄúBruce? Bruce? Wake up‚Ä¶ they‚Äôre handing out rations.‚Äù nudged a Bavarian Jager. Bruce would sit and look off deep into the distance, lost in his eyes. Motionless. A figure pitiful and ragged, that no Austrian would look at him without having to laugh at the great Bruce Aeigh, a legend amongst the Bavarians in the Army. ‚ÄùBruce‚Ä¶ she‚Äôs lost mate. You can‚Äôt starve yourself for her to find you dead if she‚Äôs alive out there..‚Äù pleaded the Jager once again.
10:35 PM
No response. The Jager stood up and sighed, taking his chipped plate and trudging to the line. Walking to the line, he fell in amongst the hundreds of Bavarians taken prisoner by the Austrians, who were particularly happy to have destroyed the Expeditionary Corps with their ‚Äúrash‚Äù decision as Austrian officers liked to have called it. While the Bavarians received what little bread there was with watery soup and one singular potato, the guards would sneer at them. ‚ÄúLost what supposed manhood you bloody lot ever had eh? Good on us for giving you the spanking you deserve.‚Äù one would laugh. Some Bavarians would look at them infuriated, wishing whatever death came to their mind. Others would not respond and wait for their food, lost in their thoughts and hopelessness. It was finally the Jager‚Äôs turn to receive his ration. As he raised his bowl, the cook would put one half-ladleful of the soup and hand him a small potato. The Jager raised his eyebrow at the cook. ‚ÄúRespectfully mein herr, should I not receive the same as the other men?‚Äù The cook jeered at him. ‚ÄúUnfortunately for you, your highness, we are done serving rations. Be grateful I decided to scrape the bottom of the pot you miscreant. Now out of line!‚Äù The Jager shook his head. ‚ÄúI see you have a box of potatoes left over. Should the men not have them?‚Äù he pointed to all of them in line. The cook gave him a glare. ‚ÄúIs that so? Well Bavarian, you are trying my patience. OUT! OF! LINE!‚Äù he yelled. The Jager protested once more, ‚ÄúSir, do you not see these men, these hungry, destitute, soldiers who-‚Äù Stopping him mid-conversation, the cook yelled for guards to arrive and deal with the Jager. They promptly arrived and attempted to drag him out of line.
10:39 PM
Having enough, the Jager wrestled loose and rushed onto some discarded crates, standing and bellowing to the amazement of the Bavarians gathering close ‚ÄúENOUGH IS ENOUGH! MY FELLOW SOLDIERS, COUNTRYMEN! ENOUGH OF THIS MISTREATMENT! THE SONS OF BAVARIA WILL NOT TOLERATE THE BOOT OF THE AUSTRIANS TO FALL UPON US AND DEFACE OUR PRIDE! WE DEMAND BETTER FOOD AND RESPECT! IT IS WHAT WE ASK AND PROCLAIM SO FROM THIS VERY MO-!‚Äù CRACK! The Jager paused in his monologue, slowly looking at the sky. Sighing a slow heavy breath, he crumpled to the ground, motionless. A musket-ball in his head. The Bavarians stare at him in shock and try to locate the source of the shot. Five Austrians are gathered in a group, one of the soldiers with a raised musket with smoke slowly flowing freely out the barrel. He retracts the musket and smirks. ‚ÄúVery inspirational. Back to your places scum.‚Äù he spits and then marches off with his comrades. A minute passes before the Bavarians slowly break off into their respective places, while a few walk over to the body and lift it solemnly to leave him at the side of the camp. Yet as we still see, Bruce is sitting there. No movement, no change from last time. He is just there. As still as a broken clock. However‚Ä¶ his mind seems to run with some thoughts.‚Äú.... enough is enough‚Ä¶.. For I must make a decision and break out of this hell‚Ä¶ how‚Ä¶. Soldiers‚Ä¶. Or no‚Ä¶. Zoe‚Ä¶?..‚Äù he mutters incohesively. But one thing is understood. He wants to be gone from this internment camp. As soon as possible. Bruce Aeigh Part 3‚Ä¶ begins. @Text Story 1Ô∏è‚É£ Begin the plan by escaping by yourself 2Ô∏è‚É£ Begin the plan by escaping with your comrades 3Ô∏è‚É£ Escape with the intent of finding Zoe 4Ô∏è‚É£ Escape to locate friendly troops nearby P.S, you have to pick a choice from the first two 1Ô∏è‚É£-2Ô∏è‚É£ and another choice from 3Ô∏è‚É£-4Ô∏è‚É£. This is crucial to your planning. (edited)

billy big balls 9/21/2024 11:14 PM
Bruce mutters a bit more before finally struggling to get up. A Bavarian soldier notices him and immediately rushes over to assist him. ‚ÄúMein Kapitan, it seems you may have some strength with you after all,‚Äù he tries to console him with a joke. ‚ÄúWe thought you would never speak to us and lie there to perish!" Bruce shook his head, and with a broken voice spoke: ‚ÄúBavaria and her Sons need me.‚Äù The soldier nodded in agreement vigorously. ‚ÄúYes mein Kapitan, absolutely.‚Äù They trudged around a bit to the awe of the Bavarian soldiers, some of who bowed their heads in respect or others gave a salute. ‚ÄúTake me to a tent please, and gather whoever we have that is an Unteroffizier or a Korporal immediately‚Ä¶ of utter importance,‚Äù croaked Bruce. He was promptly taken to a tent and given room to sit. While the soldier rushed to obey Aeigh‚Äôs orders, some soldiers took the opportunity to gaze at Bruce. What a sight. To see their dashing Kapitan in the rags and horrible condition like they were, yet they treated him with admiration and respect as he was unlike the other officers who were given much better treatment, but refused to join them and suffer the same conditions as his men. Minutes pass until a group of men return with the Bavarian soldiers. He presents them to Bruce, and Bruce turns and gave him a slight nod. ‚ÄúWhat‚Äôs your name soldier?‚Äù ‚ÄúAnselm, Herr Kapitan.‚Äù Aeigh thought for a second. ‚ÄúThank you Anselm,‚Äù he said before he turned to the men. ‚ÄúSo, you are my ‚Äòcream of the crop‚Äô then?‚Äù The men saluted him. ‚ÄúYes sir, I suppose that is us, what with trying to keep things in order and inspiring the men to survive this hell.‚ÄùBruce coughed and spit some phlegm next to him and wiped his mouth. ‚ÄúGood, good. I appreciate your efforts. Please have a seat,‚Äù he showed his hand around the tent. The Korporals and Unteroffiziers, numbering about 8-9 kneeled or sat and showed their attention to their Kapitan.
billy big balls 9/21/2024 11:21 PM
Bruce beckoned Anselm to him. ‚ÄúAnselm, keep an eye out for any Austrian about so we don‚Äôt raise any suspicion,‚Äù he said. The young soldier stepped outside. Turning his attention back to the group, he cleared his throat. ‚ÄúGentlemen, as you can see with such conditions in this dastardly camp and the dishonorable and fruitless deaths we are dying here instead of on the battlefield against the bastards, I have finally in my mind decided to‚Ä¶‚Äù he paused for a second. The men leaned in, looking inquisitively towards him. One of the Korporals spoke, ‚ÄúSurely, Kapitan you don‚Äôt mean?...‚Äù Aeigh nodded his head. ‚ÄúEscape. Yes. I mean just that.‚Äù The men looked at each other for a moment. "Gentlemen, realize that with the plan I shall make and hopefully in collaboration with this concentrated group, we shall use every resource and man to create a mass exodus of our remnants of the Corps from this camp and, with our good grace, locate a friendly town or sizeable military force to recover us and allow us time to rest, re-equip, and hit those bastards right in the snout!" he proclaimed to them. ‚ÄúMein Kapitan‚Ä¶ we are very‚Ä¶ well truth be told we are in our minds very happy you consider such a thing but you must realize‚Ä¶ with these conditions and our strength‚Ä¶ it‚Äôs not going to be so easy to escape this hellhole.‚Äù They give him a serious look which Bruce takes in from their tired yet determined faces. He thinks for a moment. ‚ÄúI understand. Leave me for a moment.‚Äù He gestures to them and they promptly get up and file outside. Anselm peeks inside. ‚ÄúNo Austrians, sir.‚Äù he says. Bruce snorts and thanks him. As Anselm was about to leave, Bruce beckoned him to come to him. Anselm turned and trudged inside, while standing in front of his Kapitan. ‚ÄúMy dear boy, you may have caught wind of our conversation outside, I assume?‚Äù The young soldier nods slowly. Aeigh sighs slowly while scratching his unkempt beard. ‚ÄúAnd your thoughts?‚Äù
11:26 PM
Anselm looks at his Kaptain and softly but firmly, ‚ÄúHerr Kapitan, I believe that although our chances are slim‚Ä¶ we must make an effort. Inspire the other prisoners-of-war behind held by the Austrians, force them off of our backs and finally crush them to support our kingdom which we hold dear to our hearts! Yes, I have to admit as the non-commissioned men inside said that there are many caveats and disadvantages with having to do such a plan, it may not as well be successful or not even possible, but I say we must try! O mein Kapitan, if I must die for the others to survive and keep our nation alive, I will do just that, as long as we make do with what we have and escape no matter what, even if one man gets out alive.‚Äù He finished speaking and rubbed his hands together. There is silence in the decrepit tent until Bruce slowly pushes himself up and trudges to Anselm. He pats his shoulder and finally, ‚ÄúMy dear Anselm, if I had a whole regiment of lads like you, I would have finished off the Austrians and served the battle colours to the King.‚Äù He pats him. ‚ÄúI shall make my decision then.‚Äù 1Ô∏è‚É£Commence the first steps of the plan by locating the able men and gathering resources. Time must not be lost. 2Ô∏è‚É£Commence the escape plan but take steps to make a solid plan before finding resources and possibly rooting out intelligence. This will take quite some time but it may be worth it in the long run. 3Ô∏è‚É£ Abandon the escape plan. It is not worth sacrificing all the men for what could be a fruitless event. @Text Story thank you all for allowing me to scratch my balls (edited)

billy big balls 10/5/2024 8:53 PM
Bruce stood outside the tent in silence for a moment. So many things could go wrong. So many things could end up okay. But knowing what was at risk, he understood that all that had to be done was to bring about the Bavarians and try to save what honour was left of their battered army. Anselm came from behind him. ‚ÄúAre you alright, Herr Kapitan?‚Äù Bruce slowly turned and nodded at him. ‚ÄúYes my boy. I am.‚Äù He snorted and rubbed his nose. ‚ÄúBlast this weather.‚Äù Standing with Anselm, he looked at him in his eyes and said ‚ÄúWe shall begin our plans immediately. I have a feeling we won‚Äôt have enough time to escape and if by losing that precious time, we will only complicate our efforts. Gather the non-commissioned ranks to me and find any willing soldier who wants to partake.‚Äù Anselm nodded profusely while cracking a smile and a salute. ‚ÄúYes Herr Kapitan!‚Äù he rushed to fulfill the orders while Bruce began walking around. Inspecting the surroundings, he trudged around the wooden stockades and stone walls that made up the general lay-out of this measly camp. ‚ÄúSurely if we find a weak enough area that is guarded very little we could force them out. Basic, surely, but it may help with rapid escape from this hellhole‚Ä¶ maybe.‚Äù he thought to himself. Walking around some more, he inspected the guards and their actions around the camp. From his view, they did not seem as very watchful in the area, for they were lounging about and doing nothing. He turned to his left and inspected the surrounding material that was the basis of keeping all the prisoners in. Nothing out of the ordinary so far.
8:56 PM
Until his eye caught a small out-of-the-ordinary opportunity. Right between where the wood was tightly bound to make up the basis for a wooden stockade, there was a small space that was rotting away, making for a growing crack that could be used to an escaper‚Äôs advantage. Aeigh took note of this and was about to inspect it closer when suddenly a voice rang out. ‚ÄúYOU!‚Äù Bruce looked around to find the source. ‚ÄúYOU, BY THE WALL! KOMMEN HIER!‚Äù It was then known that an Austrian soldier yelled to him and beckoned Bruce to come or there would, as reasonably guessed, be consequences. Aeigh sighs and trudges towards the soldier. Taking a look at the soldier, Bruce noticed he was a militiaman judging by his shoddy tophat with dirty insignia and the long gray greatcoat worn by him. ‚ÄúYou. What are you doing by the wall?‚Äù the militiaman asked him. 1Ô∏è‚É£ "I was getting some fresh air." 2Ô∏è‚É£ "I lost something around this area that is of value to me." 3Ô∏è‚É£ "Nothing in particular." 4Ô∏è‚É£ Antagonize the guard. 5Ô∏è‚É£ Attempt to get rid of him. @Text Story Rapid react to one of them, this is crucial to quickly unlocking the next segment of the story. Reach 95 on one of them and the next part shall be released. Make sure you understand what choice you are making for there will be a certain amount of danger if you pick the wrong one without considering the situation.

billy big balls 10/10/2024 11:16 PM
Bruce looked at the militiaman without responding at the moment. ‚ÄúI‚Äôm talking to you, what are you doing by the wall?‚Äù he asked once more, gripping his musket tighter as if he were to wield it in such a way that would have certainly caused some damage to the human body if swung well enough. Feigning ignorance, Bruce stuttered for a moment then spoke softly ‚ÄúI believe I lost something of value around this area‚Ä¶ and I wish to locate it immediately.‚Äù The militiaman smirked at him, ‚ÄúAnd what may this valuable ‚Äòitem‚Äô of yours be?‚Äù A pause between them. ‚ÄúMy‚Ä¶ well, it is a locket of my beloved sweetheart who was to be engaged to me before this whole mess had well, occurred I must say‚Ä¶‚Äù No response from the guard. ‚ÄúPerhaps‚Ä¶ you could help me find it, and well if be, I shall repay your kindness as a gentleman and an officer.‚Äù The militiaman looked at him questioningly and lifted part of the ragged blanket off of Aeigh, revealing his tattered but identifiable officer‚Äôs uniform. ‚ÄúYou are an officer‚Ä¶ but I wonder‚Ä¶ what are you doing with the enlisted men?‚Äù he said in slight surprise. Aeigh blinked at him. ‚ÄúIt is my duty as a soldier to look after my men and remain with them until the end of the war or death do us part. For I have a responsibility over them as if they were my own family,‚Äù he would say. The guard did not react until he finally gave a nod. ‚ÄúNo wonder the men revere you in this camp. I‚Äôve noticed it myself.‚Äù Bruce replied, ‚ÄúI suppose revered may be a bit of an overstatement.‚Äù The militiaman slung his musket and then rubbed his hands together. ‚ÄúI suppose we shall find that locket then.‚Äù Bruce gave an appreciative nod. ‚ÄúThank you. Really." The militiaman coughed while he trudged along the tent lines scanning the snow for the valuable jewelry. As Bruce was walking alongside him looking for the imaginary locket, he could spot Anselm directing some soldiers that were seemingly suspicious if seen by an Austrian guard.
billy big balls 10/10/2024 11:38 PM
Bruce pointed to another direction away from them. "How about over there?" The militiaman sighed and trudged over there, clearly expressing that there may never be a sight of the locket. Yet Bruce needed to divert the attention away from the guard so he could help the soldiers escape. "Sir, if I may, I will search near some tents where it could have fallen, and if you could wait for me here for a second, I shall return promptly and conclude the search with you." said Aeigh. The militiaman turned to him. "Are you sure?" he raised one eyebrow. "I can still help you find it for another couple of minutes or so before I must return to the barracks for the shift change." Bruce thought for a second and decided to seize the advantage. "Oh? When is your change of shift about to end... if you must go, then I shall not take you longer, as you have been of some immensive help to me thus so far." The militiaman replied "Well it is in 10 minutes so it's not very inconvenient..." Bruce patted him on the shoulder "Not to worry sir... I insist so I will not keep you out in this dastardly cold." The militiaman sighed, "If you insist." He gave him a small nod as he trudged off to relieve his guard position, "Good luck on the locket search." Bruce stood for a minute to make sure he was from a safe enough distance, then he speeded immediately towards Anselm. Anselm noticed his captain and smiled, "Sir! We've got some people who are willing to partake and even find resources to!-" Aeigh cut him off quickly,
billy big balls 10/10/2024 11:47 PM
"That's good, good, but listen to me. I found a way out and we must use this opportunity if we are to make the escape. From our position, if we go straight then take a right, on our left shoulder we will come across a spot that is rotten on a wooden stockade. There is enough space to utilize the cracks and break them open to allow for a human-sized hole of escape. Now the thing is, must we do this at night or day? And while we try to make our escape, should we take care of the nearest guard post/barracks or leave it at that?" Anselm looked at him for a second. "Well that is certainly a lot to process sir, but what do you think? I myself, knowing some of the guards are mixed with regular infantry and militia, I wouldn't expect a big retaliation from them, especially with the outside conditions. Might as well leave them and go without a problem." A soldier countered, "Anselm you fool, you mustn't underestimate these bastards. For Gott's sake, they executed our Jager in pure blood for speaking out against them. Any reason is enough for us to be shot, and I would rather have their throats cut and give us a chance out of here!"Another soldier piped up, "Underestimate them we must not, but there will be more blood if we try to fight them!" Arguments began to rise from the camp, which attracted four Austrian infantrymen to rush over. "CEASE THIS INCESSANT NOISE YOU BAVARIAN BASTARDS! CEASE!" They would have their muskets at the ready incase they needed a reason... or not to shoot a Bavarian. "RETURN TO YOUR TENTS OR WHATEVER HOLE YOU BURROWED OUT FROM AND STAY THERE! I WOULD HAVE THOUGHT YOU ALL WOULD PLAN TO ESCAPE FROM HERE HAD IT NOT BEEN FOR YOUR MISERABLE WHINING!"A Bavarian soldier would let out a small laugh at that, and the lead Austrian soldier, distinguishable with his greatcoat and oilskin cover on his shako, marched over to him.
billy big balls 10/10/2024 11:58 PM
"What's so funny?" The Bavarian looked up at him. "Why nothing sir." He tried to conceal his grin and suppress his chuckles. "Nothing, eh?" asked the Austrian. "Quite!" replied the Bavarian soldier. "Well then I'm sure this shall be funny to YOU!" roared the Austrian, slamming his musket onto the soldier's head, who proceeded to fall over into the snow. The Austrian soldier continued to bash him with his musket in repeated blows while yelling in a fit of rage. Some Bavarians tried to stop him from beating the soldiers, yet the three other Austrians from the patrol raised their muskets at them. "MAKE A MOVE TOWARDS OUR KORPORAL AND WE WILL BLOW YOUR FUCKING HEADS OFF! COME ON THEN!" they taunted the Bavarians. The soldiers had to step back, lamenting inside of them of yet another soul lost to the rageful Austrian corporal. After a couple minutes went by, the Austrian beating the Bavarian ceased to do so and panted heavily. He trudged back to his comrades, leaving behind a very gruesome and bloodied body which had no life left into it. "That's a lesson for all of you. Laugh at me, and I'll fucking slit your throats next," he'd threaten them with his bayonet. "NOW BACK TO YOUR PLACES SCUM!" He then turned to his patrol. "MARCH OFF!" The patrol went off and then out of sight from the Bavarians. Aeigh cleared his throat and rubbed his face nervously. "Christ they'll never stop at anything."Then, he heard a "PSST!"He turned and saw Anselm. "Herr Kapitan... we must act. For the love of Gott, or we will end up like that for no reason."Bruce looked back at the body of the dead Bavarian soldier.
11:59 PM
1Ô∏è‚É£Commence the plan with focus being on concentrating all efforts of escaping through the crack of the stockade. 2Ô∏è‚É£Commence the plan with the focus of taking care of the guards simultaneously while also dealing with the escape through the wall. 3Ô∏è‚É£ Commence the plan with taking the camp from the Austrians and see what we can do from there. 4Ô∏è‚É£Call off the plan. Anselm may as well be overreacting. Who's to say they'll kill everyone inhumanely? Surely not... @Text Story Gruesome gruesome gruesome... make your choices right... or there's gonna be a lot of shit going down... (edited)

billy big balls 10/25/2024 8:49 AM
Bruce gritted his teeth in anger and then sped towards Anselm. He pulled him in. ‚ÄúTonight. At the latest instance of dusk. Have someone yell out the regimental ‚ÄúTO ARMS!‚Äù command as the signal. Pass the word. Now.‚Äù Bruce pulled away and sped off to ensure there weren‚Äôt any issues in having to deal with the crack. Meanwhile Anselm set off to spread the word amongst the men, emphasizing to each soldier to keep what was told a secret until the time had come. Soon, dusk set in. The night was cold like any other, but the mood was warm and a touch exciting in the camp. Was this to be the night where finally, action could be done? As the dusk became darker and darker and set into night, the soldiers waited, and waited. The mood was tense. Shivering but taut, they were awaiting the moment, no matter how weak or strong they were. A lonesome blare rose out of the tents, and the sound, all too familiar to the soldiers of the Bavarian Army, was played in the tune of the regimental ‚ÄúTo Arms!‚Äù command. ‚ÄúZU DEN WAFFEN!‚Äù yelled Anselm, and at once, the mass of Bavarians rushed out tents, small stockades, sheds, and they immediately ran to the spot. Already, Bruce Aeigh was there chipping away with a medium stick, trying to force some results. The men immediately joined in, and with their hands, body weight, or any tool they had, they poked, prodded, pushed until creaks could be heard. ‚ÄúIT‚ÄôS GIVING AWAY!‚Äù They cheered in excitement and with all their strength, they began to increase the width of escape. Until shots rang out. The Bavarians steered their heads to their right and witnessed Austrian soldiers and militiamen forming into firing lines to suppress their escape. Bavarian soldiers fell one by one as the musketballs hit their targets or flew over their heads, causing them to duck. Immediately, a group of Bavarians at the crack escape got up and ran from the mass of Bavarians. ‚ÄúWHERE ARE THEY GOING?‚Äù yelled Bruce.
billy big balls 10/25/2024 9:00 AM
Yet the noise was too loud, and although more Bavarians were being shot, many persevere in opening the crack. "BREAK IT! BAVARIA NEED US LADS! STRENGTH! STRENGTH!" yell a couple soldiers in motivation. The wooden stockade begins to creak and slowly bend. A furor is high in the air, and with dead bodies beginning to become numerous and heavy breaths wearing out the weak, multiple yells are heard. The Austrians shooting at them look to their left. CRACK! A Bavarian soldier rushes the nearest one and punches his jaw. The group of Bavarians that fled from the escape route all pile on to the Austrians, for it seemed they would give up their lives to ensure their comrades would leave. "IT'S GONNA CRASH!" yelled Anselm excitedly. And crash it did. The stockade cracked and smashed into quarters, giving way and making some Bavarians slip and fall into the snow that lay beyond the walls. "GO GO GO!" they all yell and they rush out, finally having a taste of what lay outside the camp. The survivors band together as Anselm consults Bruce. "Sir, what's the next step?" Bruce gave him a weak smile, "Forage, arm ourselves, and let us find the nearest Bavarian regiment nearest us." Anselm saluted "Right away sir!" But Bruce suddenly took his shoulder. "One more thing between us. I do not want this to get in the way of the men as it is a task that I should take, but I must find my beloved Zoe. Somehow I must." Anselm looked into Bruce's eyes and nodded. "I'll help you sir, as a thank you for everything. It must be done." "THEY'RE POURING OUT OF CAMP!" yelled a Bavarian. Bruce Aeigh and Anselm turned to see the gates of the prison open, with a swath of Austrians moving out. One of them dragged a Bavarian with him, and in clear view of the escapees, shot him with his pistol. "THOSE BASTARDS! THOSE FUCKING BASTARDS!" cried a Bavarian. It was if almost the escapees wanted to turn back and hurt them, but Bruce yelled clearly:
billy big balls 10/25/2024 1:26 PM
"DO NOT ENGAGE! YOU WILL DIE AND WHAT HOPE HAVE WE TO RETURN TO OUR LINES?! SOLDIERS OF THE CORPS, FOLLOW ME!" he waved his arm in a swift motion. The Bavarians faltered for a second but recognizing the consequences, they ran with Bruce. A soldier yelled, "HERR KAPITAN! THE FOREST COULD PROVIDE US SOME COVER! THE AUSTRIANS ARE PURSUING US!" Aeigh looked behind him and saw the infantry follow in pursuit of the escapees, with some mounted on horses. "Blast it. They're gonna pick us off." he grunted. But then he noticed a small roped bridge up ahead, connecting the camp to the outskirts of a snowy road leading to somewhere. "AEIGH! AEIGH!" yelled Anselm. Bruce turned around and saw him with 6 men, armed with Austrian muskets and a couple ammunition pouches, plus with a couple axes between them. "WE TOOK THEM FROM THE GUARDS!" Now Bruce's thinking set into action. 1Ô∏è‚É£ Lure the infantry into the forest and pick them off 2Ô∏è‚É£Escape into the forest and hide until the coast is clear 3Ô∏è‚É£ Have Anselm and the men hold them off with the muskets 4Ô∏è‚É£ Cut the bridge. @Text Story boom boom. so far so good, but you lost many men :P

BarterLy started a thread. 10/25/2024 7:39 PM
billy big balls 11/13/2024 12:09 AM
He raised his arm, "YOU TWO! HEAD TO THE BRIDGE IMMEDIATELY AND BEGIN CHOPPING IT OFF! THE REST OF YOU, FALL ON ME AND FIRE UPON THE INFANTRY ON HORSEBACK!"" The two men with the axes gave their muskets to Bruce and another soldier while they rushed off to do their deed. "MOVE!" yelled Bruce and they trudged along behind them. Three horses were closely following them. "TURN! AIM! AND, FIRE!"commanded Bruce Aeigh, and organized fire cut down two of the horses, scaring the other one and throwing off the infantryman who fled. "GRAB HIS MUSKET AND MOVE!" he yelled, as the men reloaded and continued to head to the bridge. While heading there, they had the unfortunate moments of witnessing their comrades who were split apart being shot and/or sliced at by the Austrians who spared nothing to suppress their anger at this escape. This only strengthened the resolve of the Bavarians with whatever energy they had to escape. Soon enough, the Bavarians crossed the bridge and made it to the other side, but not before the Austrians began to rush closer and closer, taking the time to shoot when they had the opportunity to. Bruce looked at the axemen and yelled "LET HER LOOSE!" The axemen nodded and whacked away at the strands of rope. Yet as they tried to hack away, it would not simply go. "THE ROPES ARE FROZEN!" they yelled at him. As one of them tried to hack away some more, shots rang out and he was thrown over the bridge from the impact, yelling as he fell into the river. The other axeman, fearing for his life, attempted to run but was cut down and wounded as he groaned in pain. "COVERING FIRE!" yelled Bruce, and he rushed immediately to drag him to safety. The Bavarians opened fire and were able to score some hits on the Austrian infantry, firing irregularly to suppress them as best as possible. Bruce and another soldier took the axeman to safety but by the time they did, he succumbed to his wounds. "Christ almighty."
billy big balls 11/13/2024 12:30 AM
He groaned and wiped the sweat from his forehead. Again the Austrians fired and shot some of his men. They looked to be preparing to advance. Bruce was about to head onto the bridge but suddenly, Anselm stopped him. "I'll attempt to cut it and rejoin you." he nodded at him and gave his musket to another soldier. Anselm began running onto the bridge, and by wielding both axes, he began to hack and slice away as best as he could, making progress. "COVERING FIRE ONCE MORE! SHOOT AT THE CLOSEST AUSTRIANS!" yelled Bruce, and once more the Bavarians fired sparsely, yet succeeded in temporarily holding them off. The bridge began to creak. Anselm chopped off the last strand and turned to run towards Bruce. Suddenly, a SNAP was heard, and the rope unfurled quickly and fast to the effect of where it tripped Anselm and wrapped around his neck. And with his weight... the now lightly-weighted bridge crashed and began to disintegrate, falling into the river. There was no sign of him. Bruce was motionless for a second. "Shit." he said in his head. "What a lad." A barrage of musketballs struck some Bavarians, and getting his head back into the present, Bruce ordered a retreat. The Bavarians collected their arms and immediately rushed off away from the destroyed bridge, having lost many of their number. Snow has fallen now. And many a Bavarian were frozen and trembling because of the weather. Slowly they trudged on and on. Bruce shuddered as he struggled to keep his coat onto him for fear of losing it. "How... much more have we got left sir?..."chattered a Bavarian soldier through his teeth. Bruce didn't respond. All he could think about now was his beloved Zoe, who he had not thought about since the escape. "Oh my dear... I have failed you. I have and I will never forgive myself for it," he thought in his mind. "Perhaps I should finish it all here. What is my purpose?" What is it...."He cleared his throat and kept on in the night with his comrades.
12:34 AM
"Herr Kapitan.... sir?" said a soldier. Bruce did not speak once again. "Herr Kapitan.." uttered the soldier once more. Bruce stopped and turned to him. "Yes, Gefreiter?" he looked at him tiredly. The soldier pointed at a light in the distance as it shone like a yellow star in the night. Flickered it did, in the midst of the cold, snowy night... at Eferding. END OF PART 3. @Text Story thank you all for joining me for the Bruce Aeigh Part 3 of this installment. I hope you all enjoy your holidays and the next text story from our writers. [CBAI] SLave Slapster57 2/13/2025 10:50 PM
You have chosen to run forward and try to distract the bugler from the sapper. Okay. It's clutch time. You didn't watch all those Skit Gaming tutorials for nothing, did you? [CBAI] SLave Slapster57 2/16/2025 6:04 PM
You have chosen to go outside and touch some grass. You turn off your device and look around. It's been a while since you last cleaned your room, and it's getting a little stuffy in here. You put on your jacket‚Äîit's nice out, sure, but it's still February‚Äîwave goodbye to your mom, who seems a little surprised that you'd choose to go outside of your own volition, and step out the front door to feel the cool wintry breeze caress your face. @billy big balls goes next
39
billy big balls 3/2/2025 11:12 PM
It is the time you all have been waiting for... maybe, who knows? No matter. But we return to Part Four of the Bruce Aeigh series... and boy it's going to be a heck of a story I'll tell ya. Last we've seen of our hero, he has wandered with some of his soldiers in a frozen forest after escaping from an Austrian-run POW camp. A light from a far distance has caught his attention, yet he does not realize the light shines from the town of Eferding, which boy oh boy.... has quite the tale to tell. Behold... BRUCE AEIGH PART FOUR! The snow slowly fell onto the roofs of the cozy town of Eferding. Austrian folk could be seen walking around enjoying the starry night, either going to their homes to see family or to spend the nights in the taverns around. Austrian infantrymen patrolling in pairs of two greeted the commonsfolk with a hearty "Gute Nacht!"as they had a significant garrison billeted to protect the town from any enemies there may be. But now what do we see? Something is going on near an abandoned sort of warehouse... a person. We see that they sneak their way around and slip through a crack leading to the inside. They trudge into the small building and let out a small cough. A match is withdrawn and tsak!A candle is lit. And closer to the candlelight... is Zoe, Bruce Aeigh's fiancee and battle damsel, weary, cold, but gritted and determined. "Finally, somewhere I can rest for a bit,"she'd mutter as she'd take her cloak and set it down. She would sit and adjust the candle to sit perfectly onto a discarded metal piece while she had her hands around it and blow onto them. "Oh my dear Bruce... how I wish I was in your embrace in such a night..." For it was what felt like a lifetime to her since the Austrian Grenadiers separated her from Bruce and his comrades in Schustern. Blood, bodies laying on the ground, ambushes, musket shots and bayonet clangs... it was all beginning to rush back to her mind now.
11:18 PM
But now she needed to focus, as she had to find a way to locate Bruce immediately and reunite in the best possible conditions. From rumours she heard while wandering across the country, the Austrians were planning to strike at key Bavarian advance lines not far from Northern Austria, and if they succeeded, it would be chaos and a resounding victory for the Austrians. She'd take a small dagger and thoughtfully carve some notches into the wood below her. "What am I to do... what am I... to do." She would perk up suddenly. 1Ô∏è‚É£ Blend in with the townsfolk and go on a reconnaissance/spying mission and possibly gain trust amongst important people. 2Ô∏è‚É£ Hunker down where you are and try to grab supplies wherever you can to augment your position. 3Ô∏è‚É£ Wander around the town like the lost person you are. @Text Story Let's get some good votes in. Please make sure y'all read the story thoroughly and make smart decisions by thinking about what outcomes can come out of the character choices you make!

11:18 PM
billy big balls 3/6/2025 11:13 PM
Zoe would give a small grin. "Yes... I think that's going to work." She stood up confidently and blew out her candle. Fixing herself, she tried to look as best as she could an average civilian would during the Napoleonic times and walked out into the town. Greeting people, she took mental notes of various places. The first stop was a sizeable tavern, with it's warmth radiating out and the smell of delicious stew and cider alike reaching her nose. "Smells like heaven..." she would say as she walked on. Next, she came across some lodgings, with people walking in and out as if it were a business hall. "Could be useful if I need a place to stay at."as she'd peer around and notice its spartan but beckoning conditions that a person staying for a few days would enjoy. She would trudge on through the snow-covered cobblestones until she came across... The garrison. Two Austrian soldiers were on guard duty in front of the gates that led to the tented areas of the soldiers and buildings requisitioned by the officers for military use. It was hard to discern of anything just from outside, as it was dark and snowing, but just maybe, Zoe could manage something. As she started at the garrison in front of her, a voice called out "HEY! What are you standing about for?"She would turn to see one of the Austrian sentries march to her and look her dead in the eyes. She would pause for a second. "I-"He would raise an eyebrow. "Awfully late to be around this area, especially as you're looking at our garrison with quite an interest."She would pause for a moment. Then, "Well my good sir, I know it is of late tidings but I thought I would have saw my..." she'd stop. "Your?" asked the sentry. She thought for a second and then said, "My lover. I thought my lover was around here somewhere."The sentry would smirk. "A soldier is he, your lover?" Zoe would nod. The soldier would let out a sigh and scratch his mustache. "What's his name?"
billy big balls 3/6/2025 11:33 PM
"Artemus. Artemus Kaltern."The sentry would think for a moment. "First I've heard of that name. Are you sure he's in this regiment?"Zoe would shrug, "All I know is that he is serving in a sort of regiment... the 9th I believe."A small chuckle would come out from the sentry. "My good madame, unfortunately this is the 48th Regiment... the 9th may very well be stationed elsewhere or most likely sent to the front against the Bavarians nearby."Zoe, although not expressing it outwardly, asked "The front? Where?..." "A good 63 kilometers from here I believe in... Hauzenburg. They're going to send us out soon enough anywho to support them."Zoe could not believe this. It seemed so far yet so close. Perhaps there may be a salvation for the Bavarians after all depending on the situation. "Thank you... at least I can be at peace knowing where he may be if he were to be there." she would say. "Not a problem madame," would the sentry reply and tip his kaskett helmet. He would then crisply do an about face and return to his position. Walking back to the center of Eferding, Zoe felt a bit tired and a touch hungry as she barely ate anything up until this day. "Goodness me I'm starving." she'd groan. She would look around the town now, noticing fewer and fewer people on the streets. "It is getting late, and I need to figure out how the heck I can work this information to my advantage..."Zoe patted herself and made sure her dagger, a few guldens, and a locket of Bruce were with her. 1Ô∏è‚É£Go to the Tavern and settle there for a bit.
