billy big balls 3/15/2025 11:28 PM
As the moon was moving along the sky, Zoe's footsteps crunched on the snow as she walked to her decided location, the Tavern. She would need some food to regain her strength and pry some information that would very well be needed. Finally, Zoe was outside the front entrance of the Tavern. The sign read "Ebernisch's Tavernhause" and the smell of freshly cooked bratwurst and cider emanated from inside. The smells enticed her to open the creaking door and step inside the warmth. Closing it behind her, she rubbed her hands. There was a sizeable crowd doing various activites, either eating, playing tavern games, or simply debating each other. Soldiers, small groups of women, men, families alike bantered. Zoe walked straight ahead to the serving area. There, a middle-aged man with grey mutton-chops and a mustache accompanied by classical glasses stood there cleaning beverage glasses. She sat down in front of him. "What can I get you, madame?"he said without looking up. "I'll have an ale please," she said. He turned and began to pour the ale into a tall glass. "Much of a crowd you have here eh?" Zoe said nonchalantly. "That may be due to the garrison adding onto the number of people we have residing in this town madame. And quite a number too." He'd finish pouring the ale and slide it to her. Zoe nodded her thanks and took a long gulp. Well-needed and refreshing. She took another long gulp and set down the glass. "Thank you sir." she nodded. The tavernkeeper returned the nod and went on cleaning the various items he had around him. Scratching her neck, Zoe leaned a bit forward and asked,"I know this may seem a bit inquisitive but what exactly is the garrison here for? I've traveled various towns near the frontier and barely saw such a number of troops."The tavernkeeper scratched his facial hair. "I suppose they're here to defend us from the Bavarians or whatnot. That's the guarantee, at least."
billy big balls 3/15/2025 11:45 PM
"But," she cleared her throat, "surely they want to see some action? You know, soldiers being soldiers and whatnot..."The tavernkeeper raised an eye. "I suppose they do... but miss, I know it's not my place to ask but why are you so invested in knowing about the garrison in particular?"She stopped for a second. "Well, I thought my husband might have been garrisoned here but I was told otherwise by a soldier... so out of concern I guess." The tavernkeeper shook his head up and down slowly after the explanation."So you have been travelling many days to locate him... that is admirable of you."He took her ale glass and filled it again. "You may have this one on me." Zoe smiled. "Thank you Mr...?" "Ebernisch. Johann Ebernisch."said the tavernkeeper. "I am the grandson of the original owner of this tavern."Zoe raised her glass, "To the generations."and sipped the ale. Johann gave a slight smile and sighed. "Indeed so... damn it all... especially the state of this war."Zoe stopped mid-sip. "Could he be... an asset? He seems like he has some strong opinions about the war and he may very well be my key to finding my love..."she thought to herself. 1Ô∏è‚É£Ask him about his personal thoughts of the war. 2Ô∏è‚É£Avoid pushing anything at the moment. Perhaps you might find another asset or bloody well deal with this situation yourself. @Text Story I put in a thread so you all can share thoughts, ideas, plans, etc. Be creative and think logically!

billy big balls 3/24/2025 3:17 AM
She'd think for a second then spoke, "Herr Ebernisch... I wanted to ask you if... well simply put, how do you think of the state of this war?"Mr. Ebernisch would rub a glass slowly as he looked at her in a rather tired way. "Simply put... I'm not for wars happening anymore... you can see the damage it causes especially because of the Great Powers."Zoe stared at him. "Is that considered defeatist?"Mr. Ebernisch would give her a frown with one raised eyebrow, "Do you want to report me for it?" "No! I was just thinking... you know, it's brave of you to say such a thing considering the circumstances..." she would indirectly motion to some of the military men in the tavern. Ebernisch would give her a slight smile. "I suppose so." he would turn back to tend to a customer who walked in. Zoe would take her glass, drink it, and set it down, leaving a gulden as a thank-you. She would sit by the tavern's fireplace, warming herself up while processing Ebernisch's shared thoughts with her mind. Some laughs would be heard behind her, and although she tried to ignore them at first, the commotion was quite what was not expected for her. "You heard the news of that dastardly escape, eh?" said one of the soldiers. "Aye, those Bavarians are tough to keep under guard, I'll give you that... a whole POW escape."Zoe's ear would perk up at hearing that. "Escape...?"she thought in her mind. "Now we've got Bavarian bandits roaming the countryside and mountain areas... of course a problem for us if they augment the number of that Bavarian Corps trying to take a jab at our garrison."said a soldier as he took a long gulp of his beer. "Thankfully we're gonna get ammunition and powder in storage to deal with these runts!" piped up one of the more drunken soldiers and the group laughed and toasted to that. "Gunpowder and ammunition they say..." thought Zoe. She'd smile at what she would next come to devise on doing.
billy big balls 3/24/2025 4:12 AM
She would rub her hands again, warming them up before standing and walking to Herr Ebernisch. "Could I get a room for the night?" she'd ask as she'd peer behind her, watching the soldiers exit disorderly into the snowy outside. Herr Ebernisch would nod and hand her a key. "Three gulden please," he'd say as he noted her name down his book and chose a room for her. "Could I get one with a window please to the..." she'd think for a second. "Just one with a window, yes!"Herr Ebernisch paused, scratched over the chosen number, and wrote a new one. "Sure..."he would yawn and then lead her upstairs. Down a very long corridor, he took her to the farthest room on the right, unlocked it, and handed her the key. "Breakfast is at 8 in the morning, anything you need just.... tell me." he'd give her a tired smile. "Tschau." Zoe would return the goodbye and close the door behind her. She would light a candle and place it by the window, looking through. Right across from there laid the garrison with the white tents sprawled around some wooden buildings. "I assume that's the depot where they keep the arms..." thought Zoe as she looked through the area. She noticed the drunken cohort of soldiers stumble through the gate, laughing loudly as they went to their tents to sleep. She smiled, knowing they were a key to the plan she was about to concoct... blowing up the garrison. 1Ô∏è‚É£Make a plan as to how you are going to do this. @Text Story You chose to attack the French at the bridge from the back. You hold off at first, making sure the French don‚Äôt notice you. Then, you make your move‚Äîpressing your W key harder than you did on that last math test. Your group falls into the river, and is now moving up slowly, making sure the French are not aware of your presence. You see two afks at spawn, and every other French near that broken part of the bridge, seems the French gained momentum to charge again, and they were much harsher this time. The Russians near the spawn are falling one by one under the pressure of the French advance. They fled to the grasslands along with the skirmishers for support. We have to move quickly! You tell your friends. You now march towards a rock on the side, a perfect cover. Your friend with a rifle aims for the French soldier trying to kill a Russian, and hits the shot. The French noticed a man dying. They noticed you. You tell your friend with a skirmisher musket to aim and wait until the rifle is loaded. He does what you just said. Rando: Oh dang we really lost. This will teach them a lesson. He carefully aims for that officer, who stood still watching his rankers fight the russians, and the sound of a rifle firing emerged. The bullet, seen by everyone, hit the officer and killed him. THE OFFICER IS DEAD! The Russian spectators rejoiced! However, your friend killing that officer
2:14 AM
has brought the French soldier's attention towards you, and it seems they no longer care about those remaining russians. They're all after you. Four people, presumably from that nation, are now targeting you... and they've already started their killing plans by moving straight for you. Noticing this, you alert your friends. Now you wait. You can't put your focus on your fellow russians currently getting hit on two sides now. You see the first ranker coming in, followed by another one. The other two are behind the fencing of the bridge providing cover for those charging rankers. To avoid getting your group killed, you have them told that only close combat can help you win this. Your two friends equip their swords, while you ready your pistol. They're nearing, getting closer each second. You immediately present your pistol. As you peek, the first guy has reached your position, and you quickly fire at him. He's dead, and that other guy? He moved back. Cowards. You again check for your comrades at the Grasslands... Oh... They're all dead... They put up a good fight, as most of the skirmishers are now dead, except for 4. Now you're currently stuck. The skirmishers have come to know the plan of those nation rankers, and they're attempting to move towards your left to attack your group. You still have time. So make it count. (edited)
2:15 AM
What are you going to do? 1Ô∏è‚É£ Leave your hiding spot, and charge right at the nation rankers. [Right now, you're trapped‚Äîso might as well go all in. So unless you‚Äôve got good aim, you‚Äôre as good as dead.] 3Ô∏è‚É£ Directly confront the skirmishers by going towards them. [You‚Äôll need big balls for this one. 6:41 AM
You're finally done reloading your pistol, and your friend finishes his reload. From what you see, these light Infantry are slowly coming towards you. You wait for them to arrive. So, you tell your friend to stay here and distract the rifleman, while you flank through the river by going into this huge hole in the bridge. This should totally work! You begin your short voyage towards the Frenchman, making sure you are well hidden so that the rifleman does not see you. However, as it turns out, your friend did not do a good job at distracting the rifleman, for he decided to suddenly afk while standing and died. It's just you now. BaITextStory: OMG YOU ####### IDIOT HOW [Team] BaITextStory: What is the dude's hp [Team] istolethytoast: He's two tap You begin moving towards the rifleman even quicker now, and this oblivious fuck still hasn't realised you're after him. Once the rifleman got hit, he realised you were there and began running, however you with a knife easily caught up to him, and eventually did the most British thing, shanking him! 6:42 AM
But wait... The Russian empire's anthem didn't play... What's going on? You check the leaderboard, and realise there are still two people in the French team, those AFK guys you saw earlier... You try to rush to them and kill them, however, as it turns out, they've returned back to playing. You feel sweat dripping on your head as you see two blue coats line infantry, aiming for you, and sadly, you couldn't dodge on time. The French Republic has won The Battle of Devil's bridge You scream at the top of your lungs as the La Marseillaise plays. Your mother, who was making dinner, heard you but decided to do nothing about it.

MegaAbsol (@jactonia123) 10/9/2025 3:18 PM
You have chosen to enlist in the Kavallerie von Preußen But before you grab your good ole horsie. There are of course, five options for you and your fellow Prussian friends to pick from and each with their own advantages and disadvantages. Treffen Sie die Franzosen mit erhobenem Säbel 1Ô∏è‚É£ [Hussars] With the spirit of von Mackensen on your side, you raise your saber high and charge ahead of the allied infantry and terrify the enemy, cutting down as many as you can. If you die, you die as a brave Husaren. 2Ô∏è‚É£ [Dragoons] You get a fat ahh horse that can't gallop fast, however you do get a neat looking musketoon. While the infantry of countries skirmish in the middle, you and your big brain of yours can sneak about the flanks behind enemy lines and get some good kills off with your musketoon, just don't get caught. 3Ô∏è‚É£ [Lancers] The class could be reasonably good if the French has a lot of cavalry themselves that will cause havoc on your team, unhorse some of them as quickly as possible. Good luck with any French marksmen tho. 4Ô∏è‚É£ [Heavy Cavalry] Much like the dragoons, you get a fat ass horse but you do get a firearm to help defend yourself. The pistol obviously won't do much for long range but the most viable plan could be to sneak to the French base and cause problems there or if you're good at the game, you can engage out on the field and get rid of some Frenchies that are shooting at your friends. 5Ô∏è‚É£ [Kuirassier] The Armored knights of the battlefield or Die Berittene Ritter. There are two ways to play this class effectively however, you can either stand behind your infantry lines and wait for them to thin out the crowds of French light or rifle who no doubt will try and kill you first and then you charge in to sweep up the job. OR. you can do a flanking maneuver and pull up to the French camp in your shining armor and do some horrible crimes. (edited)
